name: made.js
one_line_profile: JavaScript library for creating and manipulating material structures
detailed_description: Materials Design in Javascript (made.js) is a library allowing for the creation and manipulation of material structures from atoms up, designed for web-based materials science applications.

name: wave.js
one_line_profile: Web-based Atomic Viewer and Editor for material structures
detailed_description: A JavaScript library for 3D atomic visualization and editing, enabling the manipulation of material structures from atoms up on the web.

name: pymatgen-io-espresso
one_line_profile: Pymatgen addon for parsing Quantum ESPRESSO files
detailed_description: A pymatgen extension that provides input/output parsing capabilities specifically for Quantum ESPRESSO, facilitating the integration of QE calculations into pymatgen workflows.

name: PyXtal
one_line_profile: Generation of atomic crystal structures with symmetry constraints
detailed_description: A Python package for generating atomic structures with specific symmetry constraints, useful for crystal structure prediction and materials discovery.

name: PyXtal_FF
one_line_profile: Machine Learning Interatomic Potential Predictions
detailed_description: A package for developing machine learning interatomic potentials, enabling atomistic simulations with ML-derived force fields.

name: QuantumESPRESSOBase.jl
one_line_profile: Julia tools for Quantum ESPRESSO input generation and structure manipulation
detailed_description: Provides basic data structures and functions in Julia for manipulating crystal structures and generating input files for Quantum ESPRESSO calculations.

name: nfp
one_line_profile: Keras layers for materials deep learning with rdkit and pymatgen
detailed_description: A library providing Keras layers and utilities for building end-to-end deep learning models for molecules and materials, integrating with RDKit and Pymatgen.

name: ScalableWorkflow_VASP_Calculations
one_line_profile: Workflow for generating randomized VASP input structures for alloys
detailed_description: A scalable workflow designed to generate VASP input cases with randomized atomic structures for solid solution binary and ternary alloys across compositional ranges.

name: readcif
one_line_profile: Fast C++ CIF and mmCIF parser
detailed_description: A high-performance C++ library for parsing CIF (Crystallographic Information File) and mmCIF formats, essential for reading structural data.

name: ShakeNBreak
one_line_profile: Defect structure-searching with chemically-guided bond distortions
detailed_description: A tool for generating defect structures by applying chemically-guided bond distortions to identify ground-state defect configurations in materials.

name: doped
one_line_profile: Generation, processing and analysis of defect supercell calculations
detailed_description: A Python package for the generation, pre-/post-processing, and analysis of defect supercell calculations, streamlining the defect simulation workflow.

name: surfaxe
one_line_profile: Tools for slab generation and surface calculations
detailed_description: A Python library for generating and handling slab structures for first-principles surface calculations, including surface energy analysis.

name: AtomicStructureGenerator
one_line_profile: Crystal structure generator using prototype databases
detailed_description: A module that utilizes the Crystal Structure Prototype Database (CSPD) to generate lists of crystal structures for user-defined systems, facilitating high-throughput materials screening.

name: CatKit
one_line_profile: High-throughput catalysis modeling toolkit
detailed_description: General purpose tools designed for high-throughput catalysis research, providing utilities for structure manipulation, adsorption generation, and analysis.

name: VASP-DOS_extractor
one_line_profile: VASP density of states extraction script
detailed_description: A Pymatgen-based Python script designed to extract total and projected density of states (DOS) data directly from VASP vasprun.xml output files.

name: VASP-Structural_Descriptors
one_line_profile: Atomic structure descriptor collector
detailed_description: A script leveraging Pymatgen to calculate and collect structural descriptors from large sets of atomic structures for materials analysis.

name: VASPIN_GEN
one_line_profile: VASP input file generator
detailed_description: A Python script to automate the generation of standard VASP input files (INCAR, KPOINTS, POTCAR) and job submission scripts.

name: mcp-atomictoolkit
one_line_profile: MCP server for atomistic simulations
detailed_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) compatible server that exposes atomistic simulation capabilities (via ASE, pymatgen) to LLM agents.

name: JARVIS-Tools
one_line_profile: Data-driven atomistic materials design package
detailed_description: An open-source software package for data-driven atomistic materials design, providing tools for high-throughput calculations, machine learning, and database interaction (NIST-JARVIS).

name: molecule-synthesis
one_line_profile: Generative AI for brain-targeting molecules
detailed_description: A multi-objective generative AI framework designed for the synthesis and design of novel small molecules targeting the brain.

name: beautiful-atoms
one_line_profile: High-quality atom/molecule rendering with Blender
detailed_description: A Python module that interfaces with Blender to create high-quality, publication-ready 3D renderings of atoms and molecular structures.

name: crawfish
one_line_profile: Pymatgen-compatible plotting tool
detailed_description: A rewrite of the ultrasoftcrawfish tool designed for compatibility with pymatgen, used for plotting and analyzing materials properties.

name: icsg3d
one_line_profile: 3D inorganic crystal structure generation
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for 3D inorganic crystal structure generation and property prediction via representation learning.

name: ase-notebook
one_line_profile: ASE/Pymatgen structure visualization in Jupyter
detailed_description: A tool for highly configurable 2D (SVG) and 3D (Three.js) visualizations of ASE and Pymatgen atomic structures directly within Jupyter Notebooks.

name: StructurePrototypeAnalysisPackage
one_line_profile: Atomic structure symmetry and similarity analysis
detailed_description: A package to analyze symmetry and compare the similarity of a large number of atomic structures, useful for prototype classification.

name: Hetero2d
one_line_profile: 2D heterostructure discovery automation
detailed_description: A tool to automate the discovery and property computation of stable 2D materials stacked on substrates or other 2D layers.

name: cod-tools
one_line_profile: Crystallography Open Database tools
detailed_description: A collection of tools and parsers for handling CIF files, maintained by the Crystallography Open Database (COD) developers.

name: atco
one_line_profile: ATCO-CIF to JSON converter
detailed_description: A Ruby-based parser and converter for transforming ATCO-CIF crystallographic data files into JSON format.

name: deepmd-kit
one_line_profile: Deep learning molecular dynamics package
detailed_description: A deep learning package for generating many-body potential energy representations and performing molecular dynamics simulations.

name: dftd4
one_line_profile: DFT-D4 dispersion correction tool
detailed_description: Implementation of the generally applicable atomic-charge dependent London dispersion correction (DFT-D4) for density functional theory calculations.

name: bandstructureplots
one_line_profile: Band structure visualization tool for pymatgen
detailed_description: A Python tool to plot electronic band structures using pymatgen, featuring RGB scales to visualize atomic or orbital contributions.

name: maptools
one_line_profile: Materials simulation data processing toolkit
detailed_description: An open-source program based on Pymatgen for processing materials simulation data, facilitating input setup and output analysis.

name: chemeleon
one_line_profile: Text-guided diffusion model for crystal structure generation
detailed_description: A generative AI tool that uses text-guided diffusion models to generate crystal structures, enabling inverse design from textual descriptions.

name: ASE_ANI
one_line_profile: ANI neural network potential interface for ASE
detailed_description: A Python interface integrating the ANI-1 neural network potential with the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) for molecular dynamics and atomistic simulations.

name: jkitchin-vasp
one_line_profile: Enhanced ASE interface for VASP
detailed_description: A Python library providing an ASE-compliant interface to VASP, developed by John Kitchin, offering advanced workflow automation and analysis capabilities.

name: pydefect
one_line_profile: Point-defect calculation tool for non-metallic solids
detailed_description: A Python library for performing point-defect calculations in non-metallic solids based on first-principles calculations (VASP), handling defect formation energies and corrections.

name: CrystaLLM
one_line_profile: Large Language Model for crystal structure generation
detailed_description: A Large Language Model trained on CIF files to generate valid crystal structures, enabling generative design of new materials.

name: MPWorks
one_line_profile: Workflow management system for Materials Project calculations
detailed_description: A custom workflow package that merges pymatgen, custodian, and FireWorks to manage high-throughput DFT calculations for the Materials Project.

name: MPmorph
one_line_profile: Tools for running and analyzing ab-initio molecular dynamics (AIMD)
detailed_description: A collection of tools to run and analyze ab-initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) calculations using VASP, built upon the Materials Project infrastructure.

name: pymatgen
one_line_profile: Robust materials analysis code for structure definition and electronic structure analysis
detailed_description: A core Python library for materials analysis that defines classes for structures and molecules, supporting input/output for many electronic structure codes like VASP, Gaussian, and more.

name: pymatgen-analysis-alloys
one_line_profile: Pymatgen add-on for alloy system description and analysis
detailed_description: An add-on package for pymatgen containing classes and tools specifically designed for describing alloy systems and analyzing relevant data.

name: pymatgen-analysis-defects
one_line_profile: Defect analysis modules for pymatgen
detailed_description: A specialized add-on for pymatgen to handle point defect analysis, including formation energy calculations and finite-size corrections.

name: pymatgen-db
one_line_profile: Database management tool for Materials Project style databases
detailed_description: An addon to pymatgen that enables the creation and management of MongoDB-based databases for materials data, following Materials Project schemas.

name: pymatgen-io-validation
one_line_profile: Input/output validator for DFT calculations
detailed_description: A comprehensive validator to ensure VASP calculations are compatible with Materials Project data standards, with potential for other DFT codes.

name: pymatgen-analysis-diffusion
one_line_profile: Pymatgen add-on for analyzing diffusion in materials
detailed_description: Tools for analyzing diffusion pathways and calculating diffusion coefficients from molecular dynamics or nudged elastic band (NEB) calculations.

name: supercell
one_line_profile: Program to create regular structure supercells from CIF files
detailed_description: A tool that allows the creation of regular structure supercells from CIF files, handling partial occupancy and substitutions.

name: Atomsk
one_line_profile: Tool for manipulating and converting atomic data files
detailed_description: A command-line tool for converting between various atomic data file formats and performing manipulations like supercell creation, defect insertion, and dislocation generation.

name: DFTtoolbox
one_line_profile: Toolbox for building inputs and analyzing DFT results
detailed_description: A Python toolbox designed to facilitate the quick generation of input files and the analysis of results for Density Functional Theory (DFT) codes.

name: pyiron
one_line_profile: Integrated development environment for computational materials science
detailed_description: An integrated development environment (IDE) that provides a workflow framework for computational materials science, supporting various simulation codes and data management.

name: atomium
one_line_profile: Python macromolecular parsing and generation library
detailed_description: A Python library for parsing, manipulating, and saving macromolecular structures (PDB, CIF, MMTF formats), suitable for structural biology and materials.

name: pysktb
one_line_profile: Slater Koster tight-binding solver
detailed_description: A scientific Python package for solving Slater-Koster tight-binding topological hamiltonians, useful for electronic structure calculations.

name: catkit2
one_line_profile: Hardware control package for astronomical testbeds and telescopes
detailed_description: A Python package developed by STScI for controlling testbed hardware, specifically designed for high-contrast imaging and optical experiments in astronomy.

name: crystcif-parse
one_line_profile: JavaScript parser for Crystallographic Information Files (CIF)
detailed_description: A lightweight JavaScript library for parsing Crystallographic Information Files (CIF), commonly used in materials science and chemistry to describe crystal structures.

name: Genarris
one_line_profile: Molecular crystal structure generation and polymorph prediction workflow
detailed_description: A Python package for generating molecular crystal structures and performing robust workflows for polymorph prediction, utilizing genetic algorithms and other sampling techniques.

name: supercell-core
one_line_profile: Tool for investigating multilayer 2D heterostructure lattices
detailed_description: A Python package designed for building and investigating supercells of multilayer 2D heterostructures, facilitating the study of moiré patterns and lattice mismatch.

name: MAST
one_line_profile: Materials Simulation Toolkit for automation of calculation workflows
detailed_description: MAterials Simulation Toolkit (MAST) is designed to manage and automate computational materials science workflows, particularly working with pymatgen for structure manipulation and input generation.

name: ternary-diagram
one_line_profile: Library for drawing ternary diagrams for materials science
detailed_description: A Python package specifically designed to draw beautiful and customizable ternary diagrams (phase diagrams) without the heavy dependencies of larger materials frameworks like pymatgen.

name: High-Entropy-Alloys
one_line_profile: Tool for generating random alloy structures and computing properties for High Entropy Alloys
detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to generate random crystal structures for high-entropy alloys (HEAs) and compute various physical properties, facilitating materials design and simulation.

name: VaspStudio
one_line_profile: Automation tool for VASP job submission, management, and energy extraction
detailed_description: A utility tool designed to streamline the workflow of VASP calculations on HPC systems, including job submission, file management, and automatic extraction of calculation results.

name: CPMD
one_line_profile: Parallelized plane wave/pseudopotential DFT code for ab-initio molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A production-grade implementation of Density Functional Theory, specifically optimized for Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics (CPMD). It supports parallel execution and uses plane waves and pseudopotentials.

name: VASP2WAN90_v2_fix
one_line_profile: Updated interface converting VASP wavefunctions to Wannier90 format
detailed_description: A fixed and updated version of the VASP2WANNIER90 interface, enabling the projection of VASP bloch states onto Wannier functions for post-processing.

name: VASP_OPT_AXIS
one_line_profile: Patch for VASP to fix specific lattice components during relaxation
detailed_description: A modification tool for VASP source code that allows users to selectively fix lattice vectors during structural relaxation, providing more control than standard constraints.

name: pyw90
one_line_profile: Interface between VASP and Wannier90 for automated projection analysis
detailed_description: A Python tool that interfaces VASP and Wannier90 to automate disentanglement energy window optimization and projection analysis.

name: DMFTwDFT
one_line_profile: Solver combining DMFT with various DFT packages
detailed_description: An open-source code that integrates Dynamical Mean Field Theory (DMFT) with Density Functional Theory (DFT) solvers to treat strongly correlated electron systems.

name: vaspvis
one_line_profile: Visualization library for VASP electronic structure data
detailed_description: A flexible Python library for visualizing electronic structure data (such as band structures and density of states) directly from VASP calculation outputs.

name: ELSI Interface
one_line_profile: Interface connecting electronic structure codes with high-performance solvers
detailed_description: A software interface layer that allows electronic structure codes (DFT) to seamlessly connect with various high-performance solver libraries like ELPA, PEXSI, and NTPoly. Maintained by the Electronic Structure Library (ESL).

name: VASPBERRY
one_line_profile: Berry curvature and Chern number calculator for VASP
detailed_description: A Fortran code designed to calculate Berry curvature and Chern numbers using the WAVECAR output from VASP calculations, useful for topological materials research.

name: VASPilot
one_line_profile: AI-driven automation tool for VASP calculations
detailed_description: An automatic tool utilizing multi-agent frameworks (CrewAI) to manage and execute VASP calculations, aiming to streamline the DFT simulation workflow.

name: pyscf_TDDFT_ris
one_line_profile: Efficient TDDFT-ris implementation based on PySCF
detailed_description: An efficient implementation of Time-Dependent Density Functional Theory (TDDFT) using Resolution of Identity (RI) approximation, built upon MOKIT and PySCF libraries.

name: FLEUR
one_line_profile: All-electron full-potential linearized augmented plane wave DFT code
detailed_description: A high-performance, all-electron Density Functional Theory code based on the Full-Potential Linearized Augmented Plane Wave (FLAPW) method. Developed by the JuDFT team at Jülich Research Centre.

name: aiida-fleur
one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the FLEUR DFT code
detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the FLEUR code, enabling high-throughput and automated electronic structure calculations.

name: aiida-kkr
one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the JuKKR Green function code
detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the JuKKR (Korringa-Kohn-Rostoker) code, facilitating automated KKR-Green function calculations.

name: DFTK.jl
one_line_profile: Density-functional theory toolkit in Julia
detailed_description: A Julia package for playing with plane-wave density-functional theory algorithms. It provides a framework for developing and testing new DFT methods and performing electronic structure calculations.

name: cp2k-2-deepmdkit
one_line_profile: Converter from CP2K output to DeepMD-kit input

name: VaSP
one_line_profile: Vascular fluid-structure-interaction simulation tools
detailed_description: A collection of tools for pre-processing, simulating, and post-processing vascular fluid-structure-interaction problems, including mesh generation and hemodynamic analysis.

name: MGmol

detailed_description: A scalable O(N) First-Principles Molecular Dynamics code capable of performing large-scale electronic structure calculations and molecular dynamics simulations of atomistic systems using real-space multigrid methods.

name: Qball

name: Dipole-ACF

name: qeAPI

detailed_description: An interface/API between Quantum ESPRESSO and Python, allowing for the manipulation and execution of QE calculations within a Python environment.

name: MatPL
one_line_profile: Material Potential Library for ML force fields

name: mcpdft

detailed_description: A standalone PySCF extension module implementing Multi-Configuration Pair-Density Functional Theory (MC-PDFT).

name: MiniDFT

name: BigDFT-launchpad

detailed_description: A repository for feature development of the BigDFT code, a DFT code based on Daubechies wavelets.

name: ThermoPot
one_line_profile: Thermodynamic potential calculator
detailed_description: Python package for calculating thermodynamic potentials from first-principles calculations.

name: Matlab_Real_Space

detailed_description: Electronic structure code for molecules and clusters implemented in MATLAB, using real-space methods (PARSEC project related).

name: FermiLib-Plugin-PySCF

detailed_description: A plugin enabling the use of PySCF (Python Simulation of Chemistry Framework) within FermiLib for quantum computing applications in chemistry.

name: VASPy
one_line_profile: Python library for manipulating VASP files
detailed_description: A Python library designed for manipulating VASP input/output files, facilitating pre-processing and post-processing of VASP calculations.

name: Quantum ESPRESSO
one_line_profile: Integrated suite for electronic-structure calculations
detailed_description: An integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials.

name: q-e_schrodinger
one_line_profile: Quantum ESPRESSO for Schrödinger Suite
detailed_description: A version of Quantum ESPRESSO tailored for integration into Schrödinger’s Materials Science Suite.

name: qexsd

detailed_description: Python tools for handling Quantum ESPRESSO XML Schema based documents, facilitating data extraction and input generation.

name: QMCPACK

detailed_description: An open-source production level many-body ab initio Quantum Monte Carlo code for computing the electronic structure of atoms, molecules, and solids, with GPU support.

name: Hefei-NAMD

detailed_description: A program for performing ab-initio nonadiabatic molecular dynamics simulations, useful for studying excited state dynamics.

name: VaspBandUnfolding

detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts for processing VASP outputs, specifically for unfolding electronic band structures of supercells to primitive cells.

name: VaspVib2XSF

name: pyscf-ac0

name: RMGDFT

name: SALMON

name: pycp2k

detailed_description: A Python wrapper and interface for CP2K, allowing users to drive CP2K simulations and handle input/output within a Python environment.

name: easyunfold

detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate band structure unfolding, making it easier to analyze the electronic structure of supercells.

name: CellConstructor

detailed_description: Python utilities to handle atomic structures and interface with common formats (XYZ, Quantum ESPRESSO), primarily used within the SSCHA (Stochastic Self-Consistent Harmonic Approximation) workflow.

name: XtraCrysPy

detailed_description: A visualization tool for crystallographic structures, supporting file formats from major DFT codes like Quantum ESPRESSO, VASP, and CP2K.

name: TITAN
one_line_profile: Tight-binding suite for electronic structure of nanomaterials

name: Tramonto

detailed_description: Software for modeling nanostructured fluids using Density Functional Theories (classical DFT) and Trilinos solvers.

name: MacroDensity

detailed_description: A Python package to read and analyse electron density and electrostatic potential grid files from electronic structure calculations (e.g. VASP).

name: Occupation-matrix-control-in-VASP

name: GradDFT

name: DynaPhoPy

detailed_description: Software to calculate phonon properties (frequencies, linewidths) and analyze anharmonicity from molecular dynamics simulations.

name: Abinit

detailed_description: ABINIT is a software suite to calculate the optical, mechanical, vibrational, and other observable properties of materials using Density Functional Theory and Many-Body Perturbation Theory.

name: AbiPy
one_line_profile: Library for analyzing ABINIT results
detailed_description: AbiPy is a Python library to analyze the results produced by ABINIT, facilitating post-processing, visualization, and workflow automation.

name: Quantum ESPRESSO (AdvanceSoft Mirror)
one_line_profile: Redistribution of Quantum ESPRESSO binaries and source
detailed_description: A repository providing compiled binaries and sources of Quantum ESPRESSO, an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations.

name: HEA-ML

detailed_description: An application for designing high-entropy alloys (specifically Al-Fe-Co-Cr-Ni systems) by combining first-principles calculations and machine learning.

name: aiida-vasp
one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for VASP simulations
detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that enables running, managing, and analyzing VASP simulations in a reproducible manner.

name: aiidalab-qe
one_line_profile: AiiDAlab application for Quantum ESPRESSO
detailed_description: An application for AiiDAlab that provides a user-friendly interface to run Quantum ESPRESSO calculations via AiiDA.

name: aiida-cp2k
one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for CP2K
detailed_description: The official CP2K plugin for the AiiDA workflow and provenance engine, allowing for the automation of CP2K calculations.

name: aiida-quantumespresso
one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO
detailed_description: The official AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO, enabling the integration of QE calculations into AiiDA workflows.

name: qe-tools
one_line_profile: Python tools for Quantum ESPRESSO
detailed_description: A set of Python tools for parsing and generating Quantum ESPRESSO input/output files, often used in conjunction with AiiDA.

name: Py_xDH

detailed_description: A Python implementation and interface for XYG3 type doubly hybrid density functionals within the PySCF framework.

name: DFTQuantumDot
one_line_profile: DFT solver for quantum dots with VTK visualization

name: AtomPAW

name: CP2K Editor

name: BandUP

detailed_description: BandUP (Band Unfolding for Plane-waves) is a code that allows obtaining a primitive cell representation of the band structure of systems simulated using supercells. It is particularly useful for analyzing defects, alloys, or interfaces.

name: Beautiful Atoms
one_line_profile: High-quality rendering of atoms and molecules using Blender
detailed_description: A Python module that interfaces with Blender to produce high-quality, ray-traced visualizations of atomic structures and molecules, suitable for scientific publications.

name: CP2K QM/MM Input Scripts

detailed_description: A compilation of Python scripts developed by BioExcel to assist in the creation and setup of QM/MM (Quantum Mechanics/Molecular Mechanics) input files for the CP2K simulation package.

name: vasppy
one_line_profile: Python suite for manipulating VASP input and output
detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate the manipulation of input and output files for the Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package (VASP), aiding in data extraction and calculation setup.

name: Block2
one_line_profile: Efficient parallel quantum chemistry DMRG solver
detailed_description: An efficient parallel implementation of the Density Matrix Renormalization Group (DMRG) algorithm in the Matrix Product Operator (MPO) formalism for quantum chemistry calculations.

name: ai2-kit
one_line_profile: Toolkit for AI-enhanced ab initio computational chemistry
detailed_description: A toolkit designed to integrate artificial intelligence with ab initio computational chemistry research, facilitating workflows that combine machine learning potentials with DFT calculations.

name: CP2K
one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package
detailed_description: CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid, molecular, and biological systems. It provides a general framework for different modeling methods such as DFT using the mixed Gaussian and Plane Waves (GPW) approaches.

name: cp2k-input-tools
one_line_profile: Python tools for validating and processing CP2K input files
detailed_description: A Python library that provides capabilities for parsing, validating, and generating CP2K input files, ensuring compatibility with the CP2K input syntax.

name: cp2k-output-tools
one_line_profile: Python tools to handle CP2K output files
detailed_description: A collection of Python tools designed to parse and extract data from CP2K output files, facilitating analysis of simulation results.

name: DBCSR

detailed_description: DBCSR is a library for parallel sparse matrix operations, specifically designed for quantum chemistry applications like linear scaling DFT. It is the underlying math engine for CP2K's linear algebra operations.

name: pslibrary

detailed_description: An open-source code for building highly scalable and accurate E(3)-equivariant deep learning interatomic potentials, designed for large-scale molecular dynamics.

name: FLARE
one_line_profile: Fast Learning of Atomistic Rare Events
detailed_description: An open-source Python package for creating fast and accurate interatomic potentials using Gaussian Process Regression and other machine learning methods, with active learning capabilities.

name: NequIP
one_line_profile: E(3)-equivariant graph neural network interatomic potentials
detailed_description: A code for building E(3)-equivariant graph neural networks for data-efficient and accurate interatomic potentials, enabling high-fidelity molecular dynamics simulations.

name: pair_nequip
one_line_profile: LAMMPS pair style for NequIP potentials (Deprecated)
detailed_description: LAMMPS interface for running molecular dynamics simulations using NequIP deep learning potentials. (Note: Deprecated in favor of pair_nequip_allegro).

name: pair_nequip_allegro
one_line_profile: LAMMPS pair styles for NequIP and Allegro potentials
detailed_description: Provides LAMMPS pair styles to enable molecular dynamics simulations using NequIP and Allegro deep learning interatomic potentials.

name: SGCNN
one_line_profile: Slab graph convolutional neural networks for surface properties
detailed_description: Implements Slab Graph Convolutional Neural Networks (SGCNN) specifically designed for predicting surface-related material properties from slab structures.

name: alebrew
one_line_profile: Uncertainty-biased molecular dynamics for potential learning
detailed_description: Implementation of uncertainty-biased molecular dynamics (UBMD) for actively learning uniformly accurate interatomic potentials by exploring high-uncertainty regions.

name: PaiNN-model
one_line_profile: Implementation of PaiNN interatomic potential model
detailed_description: A simple and efficient implementation of the PaiNN (Polarizable Atom Interaction Neural Network) model for constructing machine learning interatomic potentials.

name: KLIFF
one_line_profile: KIM-based Learning-Integrated Fitting Framework
detailed_description: A physics-informed machine learning framework for fitting interatomic potentials, integrated with the OpenKIM project for materials modeling.

name: ORB Models
one_line_profile: Pre-trained foundation models (force fields) for atomistic simulations
detailed_description: A collection of machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) developed by Orbital Materials, designed to predict energy and forces for materials and molecules, serving as surrogates for expensive DFT calculations.

name: MACE-Osaka24
one_line_profile: Pre-trained MACE models for materials simulations
detailed_description: A repository of pre-trained MACE (Multi-Atomic Cluster Expansion) machine learning potential models developed by QIQB Osaka, providing ready-to-use surrogates for molecular dynamics and property prediction.

name: CUDA-MACE
one_line_profile: CUDA implementation of MACE interatomic potentials
detailed_description: A high-performance CUDA implementation of the MACE (Multi-Atomic Cluster Expansion) model, designed to accelerate molecular dynamics simulations and inference for materials science.

name: Jrystal
one_line_profile: JAX-based Differentiable Density Functional Theory Framework
detailed_description: A differentiable Density Functional Theory (DFT) library built on JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization of material structures and properties, and facilitating the integration of physical models with machine learning workflows.

name: MT-CGCNN
one_line_profile: Multitask learning integration with Crystal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks for material property prediction
detailed_description: An implementation integrating Crystal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks (CGCNN) with Multitask Learning to predict multiple material properties simultaneously, improving generalization and efficiency.

name: janus-core
one_line_profile: Tools for machine learnt interatomic potentials and molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A collection of tools and utilities developed by STFC for working with machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs), supporting tasks like molecular dynamics simulations and single-point calculations.

name: GATGNN
one_line_profile: Graph Convolutional Neural Networks with Global Attention for materials property prediction
detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of Graph Convolutional Neural Networks enhanced with a global attention mechanism to improve the accuracy of material property predictions from crystal structures.

name: nequip-eqx
one_line_profile: JAX implementation of NequIP equivariant neural network potential
detailed_description: A JAX-based implementation of the NequIP architecture, providing E(3)-equivariant neural network interatomic potentials for molecular dynamics and materials simulation.

name: mlff
one_line_profile: JAX-based framework for machine learning force fields
detailed_description: A Python package using JAX to build, train, and evaluate neural networks for machine learning force fields (MLFF) in atomistic simulations.

name: CGCNN
one_line_profile: Crystal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks for materials property prediction
detailed_description: The original implementation of Crystal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks (CGCNN), a machine learning framework for predicting material properties directly from the connection of atoms in the crystal.

name: UF3
one_line_profile: Ultra-Fast Force Fields for interatomic potentials
detailed_description: A Python library for generating ultra-fast interatomic potentials using linear regression of two- and three-body basis functions (B-splines), enabling rapid evaluation for molecular dynamics.

name: Finetuna
one_line_profile: Active learning framework for machine learning potentials
detailed_description: A python package designed to automate the active learning process for training machine learning interatomic potentials, optimizing the selection of training data from molecular dynamics simulations.

name: DeeperGATGNN
one_line_profile: Scalable and deeper graph neural networks for materials property prediction
detailed_description: An advanced version of GATGNN that employs deeper graph neural network architectures to improve scalability and accuracy in predicting properties of inorganic materials.

name: SciLink
one_line_profile: LLM-powered agents for materials science research
detailed_description: A framework that utilizes Large Language Model (LLM) agents to bridge experimental materials science with computational modeling and literature analysis, enabling automated reasoning and task execution.

name: IPSuite
one_line_profile: Tools for managing and training machine learned interatomic potentials
detailed_description: A suite of tools designed to facilitate the creation, training, and validation of machine learning interatomic potentials, supporting various descriptors and models.

name: AIMNet2

detailed_description: The second generation of AIMNet (Atoms-in-Molecules Neural Network), providing a fast, accurate, and transferable interatomic potential for molecular simulations across diverse chemical spaces.

name: ai_quantum_drug_discovery

detailed_description: A Rust-based tool leveraging AI and quantum computing concepts to accelerate molecular simulations for pharmaceutical research.

name: Exo-Striker

detailed_description: A Transit and Radial velocity Interactive Fitting tool for Orbital analysis and N-body simulations, designed for exoplanet research.

name: Nyx

detailed_description: An adaptive mesh, N-body hydrodynamics code designed for cosmological simulations, built on the AMReX framework.

name: HTMD

detailed_description: A molecular programming environment that provides tools for system preparation, simulation execution, and analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories.

name: Python-Fluid-Simulation
one_line_profile: 2D Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) fluid simulation implementation
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics method for simulating fluid dynamics in 2D.

name: AlphaPPImd

detailed_description: A tool using transformer-based generative neural networks to explore conformational ensembles of protein-protein interactions.

name: swarm
one_line_profile: CUDA library for parallel N-body integrations
detailed_description: A C++ CUDA library designed for high-performance parallel N-body integrations, focusing on astrophysical simulations.

name: atomistica
one_line_profile: Library of interatomic potentials for ASE and LAMMPS
detailed_description: A library providing various interatomic potentials for molecular dynamics, compatible with ASE and LAMMPS interfaces.

name: molecular-design-toolkit

detailed_description: A Python toolkit integrated with Jupyter notebooks for setting up, running, and visualizing molecular simulations.

name: WarpX

detailed_description: An advanced, highly parallel electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code for plasma physics simulations, supporting mesh refinement.

name: SLIDE

detailed_description: A C++ code that simulates the degradation of lithium-ion cells using single particle models extended with various degradation models.

name: GromacsWrapper

name: MDPOW

detailed_description: A C# OpenGL application for running GPU-accelerated Newtonian particle simulations.

name: CRPropa3

detailed_description: A Rust library for N-body simulations featuring Barnes-Hut and GPU-accelerated algorithms.

detailed_description: A Python tool designed to process and visualize the results of molecular dynamics simulations performed with GROMACS.

name: gromacs_copilot

detailed_description: A tool that leverages Large Language Models to assist in setting up and running GROMACS molecular dynamics simulations.

name: SENPAI

detailed_description: A molecular dynamics simulation software package written in C.

name: exaStamp

detailed_description: A JavaScript-based tool for visualizing and running real-time gravity and N-Body simulations.

name: Cabana

name: Geant4

name: panedr

detailed_description: A Python library to read Gromacs EDR (energy) files and populate pandas DataFrames, enabling easy analysis and plotting of energy terms from simulations.

detailed_description: A mini-application designed to mimic the performance characteristics of molecular dynamics codes, used primarily for benchmarking and optimizing MD algorithms on various hardware architectures.

detailed_description: A Python package specifically designed for the identification and analysis of fluid interfaces in molecular simulations.

name: GaMD-OpenMM

detailed_description: An implementation of Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics (GaMD) for the OpenMM toolkit, enabling unconstrained enhanced sampling and free energy calculations of biomolecules.

detailed_description: A general-purpose coarse-grained molecular dynamics simulation package designed for flexibility and performance in simulating biomolecular and material systems.

detailed_description: Exploratory work and tools for performing free energy calculations with GROMACS using the 'separated topologies' approach.

name: SolvationToolkit

detailed_description: A toolkit for setting up arbitrary solute-solvent mixtures for molecular simulations in GROMACS, Amber, OpenMM, or other codes.

name: lindemann

name: NQCDynamics.jl

detailed_description: A Julia package for performing fast and flexible nonadiabatic molecular dynamics simulations, supporting various methods for quantum-classical dynamics.

name: Sire

detailed_description: A molecular simulations framework that provides a comprehensive set of tools for prototyping and developing molecular simulation algorithms.

name: OpenMD

name: OpenTOPAS

detailed_description: A Monte Carlo tool for particle simulation, widely used in medical physics and related fields for simulating particle interactions.

name: PHARE

name: openmm-mcp-server

name: MD-TASK

name: RadonPy

detailed_description: RadonPy is a Python library designed to automate physical property calculations for polymer informatics. It integrates with molecular dynamics (MD) and density functional theory (DFT) engines to compute properties like thermal conductivity, refractive index, and density for large sets of polymers.

name: chemshell-QMMM-protein-setup

name: g_mmpbsa

detailed_description: g_mmpbsa is a tool to calculate binding free energy using the MM-PBSA (Molecular Mechanics Poisson-Boltzmann Surface Area) method. It is designed to work with GROMACS trajectories to estimate interaction energies in biomolecular complexes.

name: UAMMD

name: ACFCalculator

detailed_description: A C++ tool developed by the Rowley Group to calculate autocorrelation functions from time series data generated by molecular simulation codes like NAMD. It is useful for analyzing dynamic properties from trajectory data.

name: NNP-MM

detailed_description: Scripts and interface code to couple TorchANI (a neural network potential library) with the NAMD molecular dynamics engine, enabling QM/MM-style simulations where the QM region is described by a machine learning potential.

name: PLAMS

detailed_description: PLAMS (Python Library for Automating Molecular Simulations) is a powerful library to manage and automate computational chemistry workflows. It provides interfaces to various simulation engines (like ADF, BAND, Quantum ESPRESSO) and handles job execution and data management.

name: SPARC

detailed_description: SPARC (Simulation Package for Ab-initio Real-space Calculations) is a code for performing electronic structure calculations using Density Functional Theory (DFT) with a real-space finite-difference method. It is designed for high-performance computing and scalability.

name: PySAGES

detailed_description: PySAGES is a Python-based suite for performing advanced sampling simulations (e.g., metadynamics, ABF). It interfaces with MD engines like HOOMD-blue and OpenMM to enable enhanced sampling methods through a user-friendly Python API.

name: SSAGES
one_line_profile: Engine-agnostic library for advanced sampling in MD
detailed_description: SSAGES (Software Suite for Advanced General Ensemble Simulations) is a C++ based engine-agnostic library that couples with various molecular dynamics codes (LAMMPS, GROMACS, etc.) to perform advanced sampling techniques like Metadynamics and Forward Flux Sampling.

name: SWIFT

name: NBodySimulator.jl

detailed_description: A differentiable simulator for N-body problems written in Julia. It is part of the SciML ecosystem and supports astrophysical and molecular dynamics simulations, enabling gradient-based optimization and scientific machine learning applications.

name: Smilei

detailed_description: Smilei is a high-performance, open-source Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma simulation. It is designed for supercomputing and supports various physics modules for laser-plasma interaction, astrophysics, and accelerator physics.

name: mdio-python

detailed_description: A Python library for interacting with MDIO (Multi-Dimensional Input/Output), a cloud-native, scalable storage format designed for large-scale energy and seismic data. It facilitates efficient I/O for scientific computing in the energy sector.

name: GMXvg

detailed_description: A Python-based utility for parsing and plotting XVG graph files generated by GROMACS molecular dynamics simulations. It simplifies the visualization of simulation metrics like energy, RMSD, and temperature.

name: Lammps_tools

name: Spectral-decomposition-python-tools

detailed_description: Python tools for computing spectral heat current distributions using data from Non-Equilibrium Molecular Dynamics (NEMD) simulations performed with LAMMPS. Useful for studying thermal transport properties.

name: Tinker

detailed_description: Tinker is a complete and general package for molecular mechanics and dynamics, with some special features for biopolymers. It supports a wide variety of force fields, including polarizable models (AMOEBAPlus), and provides tools for energy minimization, dynamics, and analysis.

name: TIES_MD

detailed_description: A Python package built on NAMD/OpenMM and OpenMMTools to perform binding free energy calculations using the TIES (Thermodynamic Integration with Enhanced Sampling) protocol. It facilitates accurate estimation of drug-protein binding affinities.

name: ThermalTools

name: gmx_MMPBSA

name: AutoMD
one_line_profile: Wrapper scripts to simplify molecular dynamics simulation workflows
detailed_description: A set of shell scripts and tools designed to lower the barrier to entry for performing molecular dynamics simulations, automating common setup and execution steps for standard MD engines.

name: YAMACS

detailed_description: A set of plugins that bridge the YASARA molecular modeling environment with GROMACS, allowing users to leverage YASARA's visualization and modeling capabilities alongside GROMACS's simulation power.

name: lammps-data-processing

detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts developed to post-process data files exported from LAMMPS simulations. It includes functionality for data analysis and generating scientific plots suitable for publication.

name: OpenABC

detailed_description: A software package implementing specific coarse-grained force field models (MOFF, MRG-CG, and HPS) within the OpenMM framework, facilitating efficient simulations of biomolecular condensates and intrinsically disordered proteins.

name: AbacusSummit

detailed_description: The public repository for the AbacusSummit project, providing specifications, data access tools, and instructions for reading the large-scale cosmological N-body simulation files produced by the Abacus code.

name: CHAPERONg

name: Acts

name: LAMMPS (AdvanceSoft)

name: acpype
