detailed_description: A tool based on Python that interfaces with Antechamber to generate topologies for various molecular dynamics engines (like GROMACS and CHARMM) from chemical structure files, simplifying force field assignment.

name: Py-SPHViewer
one_line_profile: SPH rendering framework for cosmological simulations
detailed_description: A Python framework for rendering and visualizing cosmological simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) scheme, allowing for high-quality visualization of large-scale particle data.

name: grav_sim
one_line_profile: N-body gravity simulation library with C and Python API
detailed_description: A library for performing N-body gravity simulations, providing both C and Python APIs. It allows users to simulate gravitational interactions in astrophysical systems with high performance.

name: atomify
one_line_profile: Browser-based real-time molecular dynamics visualization
detailed_description: A tool that enables real-time molecular dynamics simulations and visualization directly in a web browser using LAMMPS. It serves as a platform for interactive exploration of molecular systems.

name: Halotools
one_line_profile: Python package for modeling large-scale structure and galaxy evolution
detailed_description: A specialized Python package for studying large-scale structure, cosmology, and galaxy evolution. It provides tools to populate N-body simulations with galaxies using Halo Occupation Distribution (HOD) and other semi-empirical models.

name: CP2K_Editor
one_line_profile: GUI for creating and editing CP2K input files
detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed to assist users in creating and editing complex input files for the CP2K atomistic simulation software, simplifying the setup process for calculations.

name: MDBenchmark
one_line_profile: Tool to generate, start, and analyze benchmarks for molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: MDBenchmark is a Python package designed to automate the benchmarking of molecular dynamics simulations. It handles the generation of input files, submission of jobs to clusters, and analysis of performance data to help researchers optimize simulation parameters.

name: mdgen
one_line_profile: Generative modeling library for molecular dynamics trajectories
detailed_description: mdgen is a library for the generative modeling of molecular dynamics trajectories. It leverages machine learning techniques to generate synthetic trajectories that capture the statistical properties of molecular systems.

name: pdbremix
one_line_profile: Library to analyze PDB files and run molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: pdbremix is a Python library that provides an interface to analyze PDB files, setup and run molecular dynamics simulations (wrapping tools like GROMACS or NAMD), and analyze the resulting trajectories.

name: GPUMD
one_line_profile: General-purpose graphics processing units molecular dynamics package
detailed_description: GPUMD is a highly efficient molecular dynamics simulation package designed to run entirely on GPUs. It supports various force fields and is optimized for large-scale simulations and thermal transport calculations.

name: OpenMM-Python-Force
one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin to define forces using Python code
detailed_description: A plugin for the OpenMM molecular simulation toolkit that allows users to define custom forces and potential energy functions using pure Python code, facilitating rapid prototyping and integration of complex force fields.

name: BAMBOO
one_line_profile: AI-driven machine learning force field for electrolyte simulations
detailed_description: BAMBOO (Bytedance AI Molecular BOOster) is a machine learning force field framework designed for precise and efficient simulations, with a specific focus on electrolyte systems.

name: FLOWVPM.jl
one_line_profile: Meshless large eddy simulation via reformulated vortex particle method
detailed_description: FLOWVPM.jl is a Julia package for performing meshless large eddy simulations (LES) using the reformulated vortex particle method (VPM), suitable for fluid dynamics research.

name: DL_POLY
one_line_profile: General purpose classical molecular dynamics simulation software
detailed_description: DL_POLY is a general-purpose classical molecular dynamics (MD) simulation software package developed at Daresbury Laboratory. It is designed to support a wide range of molecular systems and force fields.

name: martinize.py
one_line_profile: Tool to create coarse-grained Martini input files for GROMACS
detailed_description: martinize.py is a widely used script/tool for converting atomistic PDB structures into coarse-grained Martini force field topologies and input files suitable for GROMACS simulations.

name: NeuralMD
one_line_profile: Neural network-based molecular dynamics for protein-ligand binding
detailed_description: NeuralMD is a software framework that utilizes neural networks to enhance molecular dynamics simulations, specifically targeting protein-ligand binding processes to improve sampling efficiency and accuracy.

name: openmmtools
one_line_profile: Batteries-included toolkit for OpenMM molecular simulation
detailed_description: openmmtools is a comprehensive collection of tools and utilities for the OpenMM molecular simulation engine. It includes integrators, test systems, and MCM moves to facilitate advanced MD simulations and method development.

name: perses
one_line_profile: Framework for alchemical free energy calculations and expanded ensembles
detailed_description: Perses is a Python framework for performing alchemical free energy calculations and exploring chemical space using expanded ensemble simulations, built on top of OpenMM.

name: Yank
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated framework for alchemical free energy calculations
detailed_description: YANK is an open, extensible Python framework for performing GPU-accelerated alchemical free energy calculations, particularly for ligand binding, using the OpenMM engine.

name: Streamd
one_line_profile: Fully automated high-throughput molecular dynamics pipeline
detailed_description: Streamd is a Python-based pipeline designed to fully automate high-throughput molecular dynamics simulations, handling system preparation, equilibration, production runs, and analysis.

name: flowerMD
one_line_profile: Flexible library of workflows for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: flowerMD provides a flexible library of organic workflows and extensible recipes for setting up and running molecular dynamics simulations, aiming to simplify complex simulation protocols.

name: ufedmm
one_line_profile: Unified Free Energy Dynamics simulations with OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python library that implements Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) for enhanced sampling simulations using the OpenMM molecular dynamics engine.

name: RMD_Digging
one_line_profile: Pre- and post-processing tools for ReaxFF simulations
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolkit for reactive molecular dynamics (ReaxFF) simulations, offering functionality for force field parameter formatting, structural statistical analysis, and visualization output.

name: SPLASH
one_line_profile: Interactive visualisation tool for SPH simulations
detailed_description: A visualization and plotting tool designed for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, utilizing kernel interpolation for rendering scientific data.

name: MDSynthesis
one_line_profile: Logistics and persistence engine for MD trajectories
detailed_description: A Python package that provides a framework for managing, storing, and analyzing molecular dynamics simulation data and trajectories, facilitating persistent analysis workflows.

name: ReacNetGenerator
one_line_profile: Automatic reaction network generator for reactive MD
detailed_description: A tool for automatically extracting and generating reaction networks from reactive molecular dynamics (ReaxFF or ab initio MD) simulation trajectories.

name: Cheetah
one_line_profile: Fast and differentiable particle accelerator optics simulation
detailed_description: A Python library for fast, differentiable simulation of particle accelerator optics, designed to support reinforcement learning and optimization applications in accelerator physics.

name: pmwd
one_line_profile: Differentiable Cosmological Forward Model
detailed_description: A differentiable cosmological particle-mesh N-body library for forward modeling of structure formation in the universe, enabling gradient-based inference and optimization.

name: EPOCH
one_line_profile: Particle-in-cell code for plasma physics simulations
detailed_description: A multi-dimensional Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for plasma physics simulations, widely used for studying laser-plasma interactions and high-energy density physics.

name: Grand
one_line_profile: GCMC sampling for water molecules in OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python module that implements Grand Canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) insertions and deletions of water molecules within OpenMM simulations, facilitating constant chemical potential simulations.

name: Pylians3
one_line_profile: Libraries to analyze numerical simulations (N-body/Hydro) for cosmology
detailed_description: Pylians3 is a set of Python libraries designed to analyze numerical simulations, specifically focusing on cosmological N-body and hydrodynamic simulations (e.g., Quijote simulations). It provides tools for calculating power spectra, correlation functions, and other statistical measures.

name: Quijote-simulations
one_line_profile: Large suite of N-body simulations for cosmological machine learning
detailed_description: The Quijote simulations are a set of 44,100 full N-body simulations designed to quantify the information content of cosmological observables and to train machine learning models. This repository serves as the entry point and documentation for accessing this scientific dataset.

name: so3lr
one_line_profile: SO3krates and Universal Pairwise Force Field for Molecular Simulation
detailed_description: so3lr provides an implementation of the SO3krates model and a universal pairwise force field. It is designed for molecular simulations, offering machine learning-based potentials that respect rotational symmetries.

name: LibGeoDecomp
one_line_profile: Library for parallel computer simulations (stencil, N-body, mesh-free)
detailed_description: LibGeoDecomp is a C++ library for developing parallel computer simulations, supporting stencil codes, mesh-free methods, and N-body problems. It handles parallelization details, allowing scaling from smartphones to supercomputers.

name: GSD
one_line_profile: File format and library for HOOMD-blue data
detailed_description: GSD (General Simulation Data) is a file format specification and a Python library for reading and writing GSD files. It is the native file format for HOOMD-blue but is designed to be efficient and generic for storing particle simulation trajectories.

name: HOOMD-blue
one_line_profile: General-purpose particle simulation toolkit optimized for GPUs
detailed_description: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit. It performs Molecular Dynamics (MD) and Monte Carlo (MC) simulations of particles on CPUs and GPUs, designed for high performance and scalability in soft matter research.

name: differentiable-atomistic-potentials
one_line_profile: Automatically differentiable atomistic potentials for molecular simulations
detailed_description: This repository provides implementations of differentiable atomistic potentials, enabling the use of automatic differentiation for tasks like force matching, property optimization, and inverse design in molecular simulations.

name: Grappa
one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
detailed_description: Grappa is a machine-learned molecular mechanics force field designed to improve accuracy over traditional force fields while maintaining computational efficiency. It integrates with GROMACS and OpenMM.

name: GROMACS
one_line_profile: High-performance molecular dynamics package
detailed_description: GROMACS is a versatile package to perform molecular dynamics, i.e. simulate the Newtonian equations of motion for systems with hundreds to millions of particles. It is primarily designed for biochemical molecules like proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids that have a lot of complicated bonded interactions.

name: lammps-logfile
one_line_profile: Python reader for LAMMPS log files
detailed_description: A lightweight Python tool to parse and read log files produced by LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations into simple data structures for analysis.

name: GRO2LAM
one_line_profile: Converter from GROMACS to LAMMPS simulation formats
detailed_description: GRO2LAM is a tool designed to convert molecular dynamics simulation files from GROMACS format to LAMMPS format, facilitating interoperability between these two major simulation engines.

name: GDPy
one_line_profile: Toolkit for generating Deep Potential models with Python
detailed_description: GDPy is a Python package designed to facilitate the generation of Deep Potential (DP) models. It provides tools to interface with VASP for data generation and DeepMD-kit for model training.

name: RASPA2
one_line_profile: Classical molecular simulation code for adsorption and diffusion
detailed_description: RASPA2 is a general-purpose software package for simulating adsorption and diffusion of molecules in flexible nanoporous materials. It uses Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics methods.

name: ScatterNet
one_line_profile: Nanophotonic particle simulation and inverse design using neural networks
detailed_description: ScatterNet provides code for simulating nanophotonic particles and performing inverse design using artificial neural networks. It addresses the forward and inverse scattering problems.

name: unomd
one_line_profile: Automated molecular dynamics simulation of protein-ligand complexes
detailed_description: unomd is a Python package that streamlines the process of running molecular dynamics simulations for protein-ligand complexes. It automates system preparation, parameterization, and simulation execution.

name: ommprotocol
one_line_profile: Command line interface for OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: ommprotocol is a command-line application designed to launch and manage molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It simplifies the execution of MD protocols without writing custom Python scripts.

name: gromacs_ff
one_line_profile: Repository of trusted force field files for GROMACS
detailed_description: This repository contains a collection of trusted and validated force field files for use with the GROMACS molecular simulation toolkit, serving as a reference dataset for simulations.

name: PyCGTOOL
one_line_profile: Tool for generating coarse-grained molecular dynamics models from atomistic trajectories
detailed_description: PyCGTOOL aids in the parameterisation of coarse-grained (CG) molecular mechanics models. It processes atomistic trajectories to generate CG topologies and parameters (equilibrium bonds/angles) for use in MD engines like GROMACS.

name: Negative Mass Simulator
one_line_profile: N-body simulation code for exploring negative mass dynamics in cosmology
detailed_description: A Python-based N-body simulation code designed to investigate the dynamics of systems containing negative mass particles, primarily for cosmological research and dark fluid theories.

name: JAX-MD
one_line_profile: Accelerated, differentiable molecular dynamics with JAX
detailed_description: JAX-MD is a framework for performing molecular dynamics simulations that are hardware accelerated (GPU/TPU) and end-to-end differentiable. It enables research into machine learning potentials and optimization of physical parameters.

name: GadgetViewer
one_line_profile: Interactive visualisation tool for Gadget and SWIFT N-body simulations
detailed_description: A lightweight tool written in Fortran/C for visualizing outputs from Gadget and SWIFT cosmological N-body/SPH simulation codes. It supports interactive inspection of particle data.

name: Moltemplate
one_line_profile: Cross-platform text-based molecule builder for LAMMPS
detailed_description: Moltemplate is a general cross-platform tool for preparing simulations of molecules and complex molecular assemblies. It is primarily used to generate input files (data and input scripts) for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics engine.

name: Amaceing Toolkit
one_line_profile: Input generation and post-processing for atomistic simulations (CP2K, MACE, etc.)
detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the creation of input files for various quantum chemistry and machine learning potential codes (CP2K, MACE-torch, SevenNet) and assist in the post-processing of simulation results.

name: Zeno
one_line_profile: Environment for N-body and SPH simulation and analysis
detailed_description: Zeno is a software environment for N-body and Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, developed by Joshua Barnes. It includes tools for simulation, analysis, and visualization of astrophysical systems.

name: NRI-MD
one_line_profile: Neural Relational Inference for Molecular Dynamics
detailed_description: An implementation of Neural Relational Inference (NRI) specifically adapted for analyzing molecular dynamics simulations. It infers interaction graphs and dynamics from trajectory data.

name: MCMD
one_line_profile: Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics Simulation Package
detailed_description: MCMD is a C++ software package for performing Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics simulations, supporting various ensembles and potential models.

name: kinisi
one_line_profile: Estimation of diffusion properties from MD simulations
detailed_description: Kinisi is a Python package for analyzing diffusion in molecular dynamics simulations. It uses Bayesian inference to estimate diffusion coefficients and their uncertainties from trajectory data.

name: interfaceff2gro
one_line_profile: Tool to prepare GROMACS input files using INTERFACE forcefield
detailed_description: A script designed to facilitate the use of the INTERFACE force field (for bio-inorganic interfaces) within the GROMACS molecular dynamics engine by converting parameters and generating input files.

name: LAMMPS
one_line_profile: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator
detailed_description: LAMMPS is a classical molecular dynamics code with a focus on materials modeling. It's an open-source code designed to run efficiently on parallel computers, supporting a wide range of interatomic potentials and boundary conditions.

name: Pizza.py
one_line_profile: Pre- and post-processing toolkit for LAMMPS
detailed_description: Pizza.py is a loosely integrated collection of tools written in Python, designed to provide pre- and post-processing capabilities for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics package, including file conversion and data analysis.

name: OPLSAA-DB
one_line_profile: Database of hand-built OPLS-AA parameters and topologies
detailed_description: A repository containing hand-built OPLS-AA force field parameters and topologies for over 400 molecules, formatted for multiple MD engines including OpenMM, GROMACS, LAMMPS, and NAMD.

name: OpenMM-MD
one_line_profile: General purpose script for running OpenMM simulations
detailed_description: A versatile Python script developed by Lee-Ping Wang for executing molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It simplifies the setup and execution of standard MD protocols.

name: OpenThermo
one_line_profile: Program for calculating molecular thermochemistry properties from QC outputs
detailed_description: OpenThermo is a C++ program that calculates thermodynamic properties (Gibbs free energy, enthalpy, entropy, heat capacity) using statistical mechanics based on output files from quantum chemistry packages like Gaussian, ORCA, VASP, and CP2K.

name: QUIP
one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics framework for GAP and other potentials
detailed_description: QUIP is a molecular dynamics software package that implements various interatomic potentials, most notably the Gaussian Approximation Potential (GAP). It is designed for materials modeling and integrates with LAMMPS.

name: PyRAI2MD
one_line_profile: Python Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics
detailed_description: PyRAI2MD is a Python implementation of Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics. It enables non-adiabatic molecular dynamics simulations using machine learning models to predict potential energy surfaces and couplings.

name: asetk
one_line_profile: Toolkit for Atomistic Simulation Environment (ASE)
detailed_description: asetk is a collection of command-line tools and Python utilities based on the Atomistic Simulation Environment (ASE). It provides scripts for structure manipulation, file conversion, and simple analysis tasks in computational materials science.

name: PyAutoFEP
one_line_profile: Automated Free Energy Perturbation workflow for GROMACS
detailed_description: PyAutoFEP is an automated workflow tool for performing Free Energy Perturbation (FEP) calculations using GROMACS. It integrates enhanced sampling methods and automates the setup, execution, and analysis of relative binding free energy calculations.

name: Lumol
one_line_profile: Extensible molecular simulation engine
detailed_description: Lumol is a modern, extensible molecular simulation engine written in Rust. It is designed to be flexible and easy to extend, supporting various potentials, integrators, and simulation methods for molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo simulations.

name: ComplexMixtures.jl
one_line_profile: Analysis of solute-solvent interactions in complex mixtures
detailed_description: ComplexMixtures.jl is a Julia package for analyzing the structure of complex mixtures from molecular dynamics simulations. It focuses on minimum-distance distribution functions (MDDF) to characterize solute-solvent interactions.

name: Packmol
one_line_profile: Initial configuration generator for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Packmol creates initial configurations for molecular dynamics simulations by packing molecules in defined regions of space. It ensures that atoms do not overlap and respects user-defined constraints, facilitating the setup of complex solvated systems.

name: Deeptime
one_line_profile: Deep learning tools for time-series analysis of molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Deeptime is a Python library for the analysis of time-series data, particularly from molecular dynamics simulations. It implements methods for dimension reduction, clustering, and Markov state modeling (MSM), integrating deep learning approaches like VAMPnets.

name: MDTraj
one_line_profile: Library for analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories
detailed_description: MDTraj is a python library that allows users to manipulate molecular dynamics (MD) trajectories. It provides a wide variety of analysis functions, including RMSD, DSSP, and contact maps, and supports many MD trajectory file formats.

name: LightAIMD
one_line_profile: Lightweight ab initio molecular dynamics simulation program
detailed_description: LightAIMD is a lightweight software package for performing ab initio molecular dynamics simulations. It is designed for efficiency and ease of use in simulating material properties at the quantum mechanical level.

name: Timewarp
one_line_profile: Deep learning accelerated molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Timewarp is a research project and tool that uses deep learning to accelerate molecular dynamics simulations. It employs generative models to predict future states of a molecular system, allowing for larger time steps than conventional integration.

name: Two-for-one Diffusion
one_line_profile: Denoising Force Field (DFF) framework for coarse-grained MD
detailed_description: This tool implements Denoising Force Fields (DFF), a method combining diffusion models and force fields for coarse-grained molecular dynamics. It allows for the training of force fields that can simultaneously generate structures and drive dynamics.

name: PyRAI2MD-hiam
one_line_profile: Variant of PyRAI2MD for ab initio molecular dynamics
detailed_description: This is a variant or development version of the PyRAI2MD software, providing Python-based tools for Rapid Artificial Intelligence Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics simulations.

name: Faunus
one_line_profile: Metropolis Monte Carlo simulation framework
detailed_description: Faunus is a framework for Metropolis Monte Carlo simulations of molecular systems. It allows for flexible definition of Hamiltonians, moves, and analysis, suitable for studying equilibrium properties of fluids and soft matter.

name: MISPR
one_line_profile: Materials Science Productivity for Research automation
detailed_description: MISPR (Materials Science Productivity for Research) is a software package for automating materials science computations. It provides workflows for setting up, running, and analyzing DFT and MD simulations, often integrating with FireWorks and pymatgen.

name: Psiflow
one_line_profile: Scalable molecular simulation and ML potential training
detailed_description: Psiflow is a library for scalable molecular simulations, focusing on the automated training and execution of machine learning interatomic potentials. It leverages Parsl for parallel execution.

name: GMSO
one_line_profile: General Molecular Simulation Object for topology management
detailed_description: GMSO (General Molecular Simulation Object) is a Python library for flexible storage and manipulation of chemical topology for molecular simulations. It supports applying force fields and converting between various simulation engine formats.

name: azplugins
one_line_profile: Soft matter simulation plugins for HOOMD-blue
detailed_description: azplugins is a component for HOOMD-blue that adds features for soft matter simulations, including anisotropic particles, special potentials, and integrators not found in the core HOOMD-blue package.

name: gsd-vmd
one_line_profile: VMD plugin for reading HOOMD-blue GSD files
detailed_description: gsd-vmd is a plugin for the Visual Molecular Dynamics (VMD) software that enables it to read and visualize GSD (General Simulation Data) files, which are commonly output by the HOOMD-blue simulation engine.

name: MDANCE
one_line_profile: High-performance clustering for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: MDANCE provides O(N) clustering algorithms for molecular dynamics trajectories. It is optimized for speed and can process large datasets (e.g., millions of frames) efficiently using specialized algorithms.

name: mdapy
one_line_profile: Library for handling molecular dynamics data
detailed_description: mdapy is a Python library designed for the efficient handling and analysis of data generated from molecular dynamics simulations. It provides functions for structure analysis, defect identification, and other post-processing tasks.

name: NAMD
one_line_profile: Parallel, object-oriented molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation
detailed_description: NAMD is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation of large biomolecular systems. This repository mirrors the source code maintained by the National Biomedical Computation Resource (NBCR).

name: Nbody6++GPU
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-body code for star cluster simulations
detailed_description: Nbody6++GPU is a high-performance N-body simulation code optimized for GPU acceleration, designed for simulating the dynamical evolution of star clusters and galactic nuclei.

name: OpenAWSEM
one_line_profile: OpenMM implementation of the AWSEM coarse-grained protein folding force field
detailed_description: An implementation of the AWSEM (Associative memory, Water mediated, Structure and Energy Model) coarse-grained protein folding forcefield using the OpenMM simulation toolkit.

name: PySDM
one_line_profile: Pythonic particle-based cloud microphysics package
detailed_description: A Python package for particle-based (super-droplet) warm-rain and aqueous-chemistry cloud microphysics simulations, featuring high-performance backends.

name: OpenFF Evaluator
one_line_profile: Toolkit for physical property evaluation and force field parameterization
detailed_description: A scalable framework for estimating physical properties from molecular simulation data, designed to assist in the parameterization and validation of force fields.

name: OpenFF Interchange
one_line_profile: Interchange object for storing and converting molecular mechanics data
detailed_description: A Python library for storing, manipulating, and converting molecular mechanics data between various software ecosystems (e.g., OpenMM, GROMACS, LAMMPS, AMBER).

name: OpenFF Toolkit
one_line_profile: Toolkit for molecular mechanics parameterization using SMIRNOFF
detailed_description: The Open Force Field Toolkit provides infrastructure for applying SMIRNOFF format force fields to molecules, handling topology, and preparing systems for simulation.

name: OpenMM
one_line_profile: High-performance toolkit for molecular simulation with extensive GPU acceleration
detailed_description: OpenMM is a high-performance toolkit for molecular simulation. It can be used as a library, enabling users to run molecular dynamics simulations on high-performance GPU architectures with extreme flexibility.

name: OpenMM-ML
one_line_profile: High-level API for integrating machine learning models in OpenMM simulations
detailed_description: A high-level API that allows users to easily use machine learning potentials (like ANI, Neural Networks) within OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations.

name: OpenMM-PLUMED
one_line_profile: Plugin interfacing OpenMM with the PLUMED library
detailed_description: A plugin that connects OpenMM with PLUMED, enabling enhanced sampling methods, free energy calculations, and analysis of collective variables during simulations.

name: OpenMM Setup
one_line_profile: Graphical interface for configuring and preparing OpenMM simulations
detailed_description: A web-based application (running locally) that guides users through the process of preparing molecular systems and configuring scripts for OpenMM simulations.

name: OpenMM-TensorFlow
one_line_profile: Plugin for defining forces with TensorFlow models in OpenMM
detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define forces and potential energy functions using neural networks implemented in TensorFlow.

name: OpenMM-Torch
one_line_profile: Plugin for defining forces with PyTorch models in OpenMM
detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define forces and potential energy functions using neural networks implemented in PyTorch.

name: openmmforcefields
one_line_profile: Collection of AMBER and CHARMM force fields for OpenMM
detailed_description: A Python library providing additional AMBER and CHARMM force fields for OpenMM, including support for small molecules via GAFF and other parameters.

name: Atomify
one_line_profile: Real-time high-performance visualizer for LAMMPS simulations
detailed_description: Atomify is a high-performance, real-time visualizer for LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations, capable of streaming and rendering large-scale systems.

name: cg2at
one_line_profile: Tool for converting coarse-grained molecular models to atomistic resolution
detailed_description: A tool to convert coarse-grained molecular dynamics systems (e.g., Martini) back to atomistic resolution, useful for multi-scale modeling workflows.

name: Making It Rain
one_line_profile: Cloud-based workflow for running molecular dynamics simulations
detailed_description: A collection of Jupyter notebooks that serve as a cloud-based platform/workflow for setting up and running molecular dynamics simulations (GROMACS, OpenMM) on Google Colab.

name: fftool
one_line_profile: Tool to generate force field input files for molecular simulation
detailed_description: A utility to build force field input files (data files) for molecular dynamics simulations (LAMMPS, GROMACS) based on user-provided parameters and molecule definitions.

name: OpenSPH
one_line_profile: SPH and N-body simulation library with GUI for astrophysics
detailed_description: A C++ library and GUI application for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and N-body simulations, primarily designed for astrophysical problems like asteroid impacts.

name: Nbody-AI
one_line_profile: Package for N-body simulations and transit timing variation analysis
detailed_description: A Python package for generating N-body simulations and retrieving orbit parameters from transit timing variations (TTV) using Bayesian frameworks and machine learning.

name: VELOCIraptor-STF
one_line_profile: Galaxy/Halo finder for N-body simulations
detailed_description: A structure finder (Structure Finding in 6D) for identifying halos, subhalos, and galaxies in large-scale N-body/hydrodynamical simulations.

name: StellarSolver
one_line_profile: High-performance N-Body simulation library using CUDA and Barnes-Hut algorithm
detailed_description: A high-performance N-Body simulation tool leveraging CUDA for GPU acceleration and the Barnes-Hut algorithm for efficient calculation of gravitational forces in large-scale systems.

name: lammps_interface
one_line_profile: Automatic generation of LAMMPS input files for MOF simulations
detailed_description: A tool designed to automatically generate LAMMPS input files for molecular dynamics simulations of Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs), simplifying the setup process for complex material systems.

name: PICLas
one_line_profile: Parallel three-dimensional PIC-DSMC solver for plasma simulation
detailed_description: A flexible, parallel, three-dimensional particle-based plasma simulation suite that combines Particle-in-Cell (PIC) and Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) methods.

name: pysimm
one_line_profile: Python simulation interface for molecular modeling
detailed_description: A python package designed to facilitate the setup and execution of molecular simulations, providing an interface for building systems and running simulations with various engines.

name: ProtoCaller
one_line_profile: Automation of relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations
detailed_description: A Python library for the full automation of relative protein-ligand binding free energy calculations using GROMACS, streamlining the FEP workflow.

name: cgdms
one_line_profile: Differentiable molecular simulation of proteins with coarse-grained potential
detailed_description: A library for differentiable molecular simulation of proteins using a coarse-grained potential, enabling gradient-based optimization of molecular properties.

name: pylammpsmpi
one_line_profile: Parallel LAMMPS Python interface
detailed_description: A Python interface to control MPI-parallel LAMMPS instances from a serial Python process or Jupyter notebook.

name: pyscal
one_line_profile: Library for calculation of local atomic structural environment
detailed_description: A Python library written in C++ for the calculation of local atomic structural environments and order parameters in atomistic simulations.

name: Dock-MD-FEP
one_line_profile: Automated workflow for binding free energy calculation
detailed_description: An all-in-one automated workflow for calculating protein-ligand binding free energy using OpenMM and free energy perturbation (FEP) methods.

name: NAMD-FEP
one_line_profile: Cloud GPU supported NAMD3-based binding free energy workflow
detailed_description: A workflow for performing binding free energy difference calculations using NAMD3 on cloud GPU hardware.

name: simba-ps
one_line_profile: Fast deterministic all-Python Lennard-Jones particle simulator
detailed_description: A fast, deterministic particle simulator for Lennard-Jones systems written in Python, utilizing Numba for GPU acceleration.

name: pynamd
one_line_profile: Python Tools for NAMD
detailed_description: A collection of Python tools and utilities for working with NAMD molecular dynamics simulations.

name: schrodinger_utils
one_line_profile: Integrations and analysis tools for the Schrodinger ecosystem
detailed_description: A collection of utilities and integrations for the Schrodinger software suite, with a focus on analyzing Molecular Dynamics simulations run with Desmond.

name: GNNImplicitSolvent
one_line_profile: Implicit Solvent Approach using Graph Neural Networks for MD

name: ESP_DNN
one_line_profile: GNN for predicting electrostatic potential surfaces
detailed_description: A Graph-Convolutional Deep Neural Network designed to predict electrostatic potential (ESP) surfaces of molecules, facilitating rapid evaluation of molecular properties for drug discovery and chemistry.

name: Equitrain
one_line_profile: Unified framework for training ML interatomic potentials
detailed_description: A unified framework designed for training and fine-tuning various machine learning interatomic potentials. It streamlines the workflow for developing potentials from ab initio data.

name: n2p2
one_line_profile: Neural Network Potential Package for MD simulations
detailed_description: n2p2 (Neural Network Potential Package) is a C++ software for training and using high-dimensional neural network potentials. It is widely used for atomistic simulations and integrates with LAMMPS.

name: lammps-tersoff-vector
one_line_profile: Vectorized Implementation of the Tersoff Potential for LAMMPS
detailed_description: This repository provides an optimized, vectorized implementation of the Tersoff interatomic potential for the LAMMPS molecular dynamics software, aiming to improve simulation performance for materials modeled with this potential.

name: aenet-lammps
one_line_profile: Interface module between aenet and LAMMPS for ANN potentials
detailed_description: This package provides an interface to couple the Atomic Energy Network (aenet) software with LAMMPS, enabling the use of Artificial Neural Network (ANN) potentials trained in aenet within LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulations.

name: SPINNER
one_line_profile: Structure Prediction of Inorganic crystals using Neural Network potentials
detailed_description: SPINNER is a tool for predicting the structures of inorganic crystals. It combines Neural Network potentials with evolutionary and random search algorithms to efficiently explore the potential energy surface and identify stable crystal structures.

name: gamd-openmm
one_line_profile: Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics (GaMD) for OpenMM
detailed_description: This repository implements Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics (GaMD) as a plugin/extension for the OpenMM simulation toolkit. It enables unconstrained enhanced sampling and free energy calculations for biomolecules.

name: dem_hyperelasticity
one_line_profile: Deep Energy Method for solving hyperelasticity PDEs
detailed_description: Implements the 'Deep Energy Method' (DEM), a neural network-based approach to solve partial differential equations in nonlinear elasticity at finite strain by minimizing potential energy.

name: nnpdf
one_line_profile: Machine learning framework for global analyses of parton distributions
detailed_description: NNPDF is an open-source machine learning framework used in High Energy Physics to determine the parton distribution functions (PDFs) of the proton using experimental data and neural networks.

name: nnpf
one_line_profile: Machine Learning applied to Phase Field methods
detailed_description: nnpf is a tool/framework that applies machine learning techniques to accelerate or enhance Phase Field methods, which are widely used for simulating microstructure evolution in materials.

name: DScribe
one_line_profile: Library for creating machine learning descriptors for atomistic systems
detailed_description: A Python package for transforming atomic structures into fixed-size numerical fingerprints (descriptors) such as Coulomb matrix, Sine matrix, Ewald sum matrix, ACSF, and SOAP, suitable for machine learning models in materials science.

name: PDMD
one_line_profile: Potential-free Data-driven Molecular Dynamics
detailed_description: A data-driven molecular dynamics simulation tool developed by TACC that bypasses explicit potential functions, using data-driven methods to propagate molecular systems.

name: NNsForMD
one_line_profile: Neural network class for molecular dynamics predictions
detailed_description: A Python library developed by the AiMat lab (KIT) providing neural network classes specifically designed for molecular dynamics, capable of predicting potential energy, forces, and non-adiabatic couplings.

name: AIMNet
one_line_profile: Atoms In Molecules Neural Network Potential
detailed_description: Implementation of the AIMNet (Atoms In Molecules Neural Network) architecture, a modular and transferable neural network potential for modeling molecular systems and chemical reactions.

name: aiqm-nnp
one_line_profile: Common tools for PyTorch based neural network potentials
detailed_description: A utility library providing common components and tools for developing and running PyTorch-based neural network potentials, maintained by the AIQM organization (developers of TorchANI).

name: G-SchNet
one_line_profile: Generative neural networks for 3D molecular structures
detailed_description: An extension for SchNetPack that implements G-SchNet, a generative model for sampling 3D molecular structures.

name: aenet
one_line_profile: Atomic Energy NETwork - ANN potentials for atomistic simulations
detailed_description: The Atomic Energy NETwork (ænet) package is a collection of tools for the construction and application of atomic interaction potentials based on artificial neural networks (ANNs).

name: aenet-PyTorch
one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of the aenet package
detailed_description: A GPU-supported PyTorch implementation for training machine learning atomic potentials, compatible with the original aenet framework.

name: uMLIP-Interactive
one_line_profile: GUI for universal machine learning interatomic potentials
detailed_description: A graphical user interface for running and visualizing simulations with various universal machine learning interatomic potentials like MACE, CHGNet, and SevenNet.

name: Cairn.jl
one_line_profile: Enhanced sampling algorithms for active learning of ML-IPs
detailed_description: A Julia package implementing enhanced sampling algorithms specifically designed for the active learning of machine learning interatomic potentials (ML-IPs).

name: IANN
one_line_profile: Equivariant interatomic neural network potential framework
detailed_description: IANN (InterAtomic Neural Network Framework) is a package for creating and training equivariant interatomic neural network potentials.

name: muse
one_line_profile: Builder for amorphous solids and liquid mixtures using MLIPs
detailed_description: A Python package for fast building of amorphous solids and liquid mixtures structures using Materials Project data and machine learning interatomic potentials.

name: modelforge
one_line_profile: Infrastructure to implement and train Neural Network Potentials
detailed_description: A library providing infrastructure to implement, train, and deploy neural network potentials (NNPs) for molecular simulation.

name: ART-SM
one_line_profile: Backmapping framework from Coarse-Grained to Atomistic resolution
detailed_description: A fragment-based machine learning framework for backmapping coarse-grained (CG) structures to atomistic resolution.

name: mlip-cleavage-benchmark
one_line_profile: Benchmark for MLIPs on surface stability and cleavage energy
detailed_description: A benchmarking suite for evaluating Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials (MLIPs) specifically on surface stability and cleavage energy predictions.

name: ReactBench
one_line_profile: Benchmark for ML-enhanced transition state search
detailed_description: A benchmarking tool and source code for harnessing machine learning to enhance transition state search with interatomic potentials and generative models.

name: OMNI-P2x
one_line_profile: Universal neural network potential for excited states
detailed_description: A universal neural network potential designed specifically for modeling excited states in atomistic systems.

name: phi-module
one_line_profile: Electrostatics from Laplacian Eigenbasis for NNIPs
detailed_description: A module implementing electrostatics from Laplacian Eigenbasis for Neural Network Interatomic Potentials (NNIPs).

name: qcnn-hep
one_line_profile: Quantum CNN for HEP event classification
detailed_description: A package demonstrating and implementing Quantum Convolutional Neural Networks (QCNN) for classifying High Energy Physics (HEP) events from particle image data.

name: neural-optimiser
one_line_profile: Batched optimisation algorithms for NNP driven MD
detailed_description: A library providing batched optimization algorithms specifically tailored for molecular dynamics simulations driven by neural network potentials.

name: PnP-MACE
one_line_profile: PnP algorithm and MACE framework for image reconstruction
detailed_description: Utilities and methods to use the Plug-and-Play (PnP) algorithm and Multi-Agent Consensus Equilibrium (MACE) framework for image reconstruction problems like CT.

name: painn-jax
one_line_profile: JAX implementation of PaiNN model
detailed_description: An implementation of the PaiNN (Polarizable Atom Interaction Neural Network) model using the JAX framework.

name: grappa
one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
detailed_description: A machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field integrated into GROMACS and OpenMM for molecular simulations.

name: OpenMACE
one_line_profile: Open-source C++ implementation of the MACE machine learning force field architecture
detailed_description: OpenMACE is an open-source C++ implementation of the MACE (Multi-Atomic Cluster Expansion) architecture, designed for efficient and accurate molecular dynamics simulations using equivariant message passing neural networks.

name: pantea
one_line_profile: JAX-based Python library for developing machine learning interatomic potentials
detailed_description: Pantea is a library built on JAX for creating and training machine learning interatomic potentials, leveraging JAX's automatic differentiation and compilation features for efficient potential development.

name: DAS
one_line_profile: Dual Adaptive Sampling method for training machine learning interatomic potentials
detailed_description: DAS (Dual Adaptive Sampling) provides a strategy for active learning in the construction of machine learning interatomic potentials, helping to select the most informative configurations for training.

name: DAC-SIM
one_line_profile: Molecular simulation package integrating MLFFs for Direct Air Capture in MOFs
detailed_description: DAC-SIM is a molecular simulation package designed to integrate machine learning force fields (MLFFs) specifically for studying Metal-Organic Frameworks (MOFs) in the context of Direct Air Capture (DAC) applications.

name: mlipaudit
one_line_profile: Benchmarking and validation toolkit for Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials
detailed_description: mlipaudit provides tools for benchmarking, validating, and auditing the performance and accuracy of Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials (MLIPs).

name: augment-atoms
one_line_profile: Dataset augmentation library for atomistic machine learning
detailed_description: A Python library specifically designed for performing data augmentation on atomistic datasets, enhancing the training of machine learning interatomic potentials.

name: MDsim
one_line_profile: Simulator for training and running MD with ML force fields
detailed_description: A package for training machine learning force fields and performing molecular dynamics simulations, associated with a TMLR 2023 publication.

name: hippynn
one_line_profile: Python library for atomistic machine learning and neural networks
detailed_description: Hippynn is a modular library for building and training atomistic machine learning models, particularly neural network potentials, developed at LANL.

name: deeptime
one_line_profile: Python library for analysis of time-series data and molecular dynamics
detailed_description: Deeptime is a Python library for the analysis of time-series data, specifically focused on molecular dynamics, offering tools for dimensionality reduction, clustering, and Markov state modeling.

name: HDNNP
one_line_profile: Implementation of High Dimensional Neural Network Potentials
detailed_description: A Python implementation of High Dimensional Neural Network Potentials (HDNNP) for atomistic simulations.

name: featomic
one_line_profile: Library for computing representations for atomistic machine learning
detailed_description: A library dedicated to computing atomic representations (descriptors) for atomistic machine learning, serving as a core component in ML potential workflows.

name: metatensor
one_line_profile: Sparse tensor data format for atomistic machine learning
detailed_description: A self-describing sparse tensor data format and library designed to handle data for atomistic machine learning and other scientific computing tasks, ensuring interoperability and efficiency.

name: metatomic
one_line_profile: Portable atomistic machine learning models library
detailed_description: A library enabling the use of atomistic machine learning models across different environments and applications, focusing on portability and deployment of trained potentials.

name: metatrain
one_line_profile: Training and fine-tuning toolkit for atomistic ML models
detailed_description: A toolkit to train, fine-tune, and manipulate machine learning models for atomistic systems, streamlining the model development workflow in materials science.

name: MatterSim
one_line_profile: Deep learning atomistic model across elements, temperatures and pressures
detailed_description: A deep learning-based atomistic model capable of simulating materials across a wide range of elements, temperatures, and pressures, designed for broad applicability in materials simulation.

name: lineshape_tools
one_line_profile: Tools for evaluating electron-phonon coupling effects on optical properties
detailed_description: Python software implementing the formulation for evaluating the effects of electron-phonon coupling on the optical properties of defects, designed to interface with the MACE machine learning interatomic potential.

name: pesnet
one_line_profile: Ab-Initio Potential Energy Surfaces by Pairing GNNs with Neural Wave Functions
detailed_description: Implementation of PESNet for generating ab-initio potential energy surfaces by combining Graph Neural Networks with Neural Wave Functions, enabling sampling-free inference.

name: NNPOps
one_line_profile: High-performance operations for neural network potentials
detailed_description: A library providing high-performance implementations of operations commonly used in neural network potentials, optimized for efficiency in atomistic simulations.

name: charge_transfer_nnp
one_line_profile: Graph neural network potential incorporating charge transfer effects
detailed_description: A graph neural network-based interatomic potential that explicitly models charge transfer phenomena. This tool is designed to improve the accuracy of atomistic simulations where charge redistribution plays a critical role.

name: BOMLIP-CSP
one_line_profile: Framework integrating MLIPs with batched optimization for crystal structure prediction
detailed_description: An open-source framework that combines machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) with a tailored batched optimization strategy. It enables rapid and unbiased crystal structure prediction (CSP) across a full density range.

name: lpNNPS4SPH
one_line_profile: Low-precision nearest neighbor particle searching for SPH simulations
detailed_description: A CUDA-based implementation of a nearest neighboring particle searching algorithm optimized for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulations, utilizing low-precision arithmetic for performance acceleration.

name: VERTEX
one_line_profile: Virtual Electrode Recording Tool for EXtracellular potentials
detailed_description: A MATLAB simulator for spatially realistic Local Field Potential (LFP) simulation in spiking neural networks. It allows researchers to model extracellular potentials generated by large populations of neurons.

name: EquivariantMultipoleGNN
one_line_profile: Equivariant GNN for atomic multipole prediction
detailed_description: An implementation of an equivariant Graph Neural Network designed to predict atomic multipoles up to quadrupoles. This tool is useful for modeling electrostatic interactions in molecular systems.

name: GNNParametrizedFF
one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network Parametrized Potentials
detailed_description: Models and tools for 'Regularized by Physics: Graph Neural Network Parametrized Potentials for the Description of Intermolecular Interactions'. It provides a method to parametrize force fields using GNNs.

name: torchani-amber
one_line_profile: Interface for using ANI-style NN potentials in Amber MD
detailed_description: An interface that enables the use of ANI-style and other neural network interatomic potentials (NN-IPs) within the Amber molecular dynamics software suite. It supports both sander and pmemd engines.

name: atomate2_ffforge
one_line_profile: Active-learning workflow for building MLIPs using atomate2
detailed_description: A DIRECT-driven, active-learning workflow integrated with the atomate2/jobflow ecosystem. It autonomously builds machine-learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs) for various materials such as batteries and catalysts.

name: cuda-mace
one_line_profile: CUDA implementations of MACE models
detailed_description: Provides CUDA-accelerated implementations of MACE (Machine Learning Atomic Cluster Expansion) models, enabling faster inference and simulation for atomistic systems on GPU hardware.

name: ParetoCSP
one_line_profile: Crystal structure prediction using NN potential and Pareto genetic algorithm
detailed_description: A tool for crystal structure prediction that utilizes a neural network potential combined with an age-fitness Pareto genetic algorithm to explore and optimize crystal structures.

name: GAIA
one_line_profile: Automated generation of reactive MLIP datasets
detailed_description: GAIA automates the process of generating datasets for reactive machine learning interatomic potentials (MLIPs), facilitating the training of robust potentials for atomistic simulations.

name: openmm_constV
one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin for constant potential molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A plugin for the OpenMM simulation toolkit that enables running molecular dynamics simulations under constant electrical potential conditions using the Image Charge method.

name: sGDML
one_line_profile: Reference implementation of the Symmetric Gradient Domain Machine Learning model
detailed_description: The reference implementation for the Symmetric Gradient Domain Machine Learning (sGDML) model, a machine learning method for constructing accurate and data-efficient force fields for molecules and materials.

name: TorchMD-NET
one_line_profile: Equivariant Transformer for molecular dynamics and neural network potentials
detailed_description: A library for training neural network potentials, featuring state-of-the-art equivariant transformer architectures for molecular simulations.

name: difftre
one_line_profile: Differentiable Trajectory Reweighting for learning potentials from experimental data
detailed_description: A tool for learning neural network potentials by matching experimental data via Differentiable Trajectory Reweighting.

name: AMPtorch
one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of the Atomistic Machine Learning Package (AMP)
detailed_description: A PyTorch-based package for atomistic machine learning, enabling the training and usage of machine learning potentials.

name: finetuna
one_line_profile: Active learning framework for machine learning potentials
detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate active learning workflows for training and refining machine learning interatomic potentials.

name: molview
one_line_profile: IPython/Jupyter widget for interactive molecular visualization based on Mol*
detailed_description: A Jupyter widget that enables interactive molecular visualization within notebook environments, leveraging the Mol* (Molstar) viewer capabilities for rendering large-scale molecular data.

name: MicrobeTrace
one_line_profile: Visualization multitool for molecular epidemiology and bioinformatics
detailed_description: A browser-based visualization tool designed for molecular epidemiology, enabling the integration and exploration of contact tracing networks, genomic curves, and geographic data.

name: ADplugin
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for AutoDock/Vina molecular docking setup and visualization
detailed_description: A plugin for the PyMOL molecular visualization system that facilitates the setup, execution, and analysis of molecular docking simulations using AutoDock and AutoDock Vina.

name: Alphafold2import
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin to fetch and import AlphaFold2 models
detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin that streamlines the process of fetching and importing predicted protein structures from the AlphaFold2 database hosted by EMBL.

name: KinaseDocker2
one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for kinase inhibitor binding and affinity prediction
detailed_description: A tool integrated into PyMOL for predicting the binding modes and affinity of kinase inhibitors, utilizing a Docker-based backend for computation.

name: PostSPH.jl
one_line_profile: Post-processing library for DualSPHysics simulations in Julia
detailed_description: A Julia package designed to facilitate the post-processing and analysis of Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) simulation data generated by DualSPHysics.

name: cpptraj
one_line_profile: Comprehensive trajectory analysis tool for Amber MD simulations
detailed_description: The main trajectory analysis and data processing engine for the Amber molecular dynamics package, capable of handling various trajectory formats and performing a wide range of analyses.

name: Jupyter_Dock
one_line_profile: Interactive molecular docking protocols and analysis in Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A collection of Jupyter Notebooks that function as a workflow tool for performing, visualizing, and analyzing molecular docking simulations interactively.

name: shiny.molstar
one_line_profile: R Shiny wrapper for the Mol* molecular visualization toolkit
detailed_description: An R package that provides a Shiny widget for Mol*, enabling the integration of high-performance molecular visualization into R-based web applications and analysis pipelines.

name: ArchaeoPhases
one_line_profile: Post-processing MCMC simulations for chronological modelling in archaeology
detailed_description: An R package for the analysis and post-processing of Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) simulations used in Bayesian chronological modeling for archaeology.

name: NIMPHS

detailed_description: A Blender add-on designed to import, manipulate, and visualize hydraulic simulation data from solvers like OpenFOAM and TELEMAC within the Blender 3D environment.

name: notebook-molecular-visualization

detailed_description: A library enabling 2D and 3D visualization of molecules directly within Jupyter notebooks, utilizing 3Dmol.js and D3.js backends.

name: PyMOL-PUB

detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin designed to automate and simplify the creation of high-quality, publication-ready molecular structure images.

name: PyMolSAR

name: hop

detailed_description: A Python package built on MDAnalysis for analyzing solvation dynamics and solvent networks in molecular dynamics simulations.

name: imdclient

detailed_description: A Python library for performing real-time streaming analysis of molecular dynamics simulations, interfacing with MD engines that support interactive MD (IMD).

name: propkatraj

detailed_description: A tool that calculates pKa values for protein residues across a molecular dynamics trajectory, providing ensemble-averaged estimates.

name: zarrtraj

name: ASAP

name: ring-pymol

name: domhmm

name: Jmol-SwingJS

name: Molecules

detailed_description: A mobile application for iOS devices that allows users to view and manipulate 3D molecular structures.

name: MoleculesMac

name: Caleydo

name: StructureAnalyzer

name: MDBrushAnalysis

name: phlower

detailed_description: A Python tool that applies Hodge decomposition techniques to analyze trajectories, likely in the context of biological or molecular dynamics data.

name: pymol-remote

detailed_description: A tool that allows sending data to and controlling a local PyMOL instance from a remote server, facilitating workflows that combine remote computing (e.g., deep learning) with local visualization.

name: cuemol2

name: SFG-spectra-tool

name: msys

name: Project-Minerva

name: biobox

detailed_description: A Python toolbox designed for the manipulation, modelling, and analysis of molecular structures, facilitating structural biology workflows.

name: vmd-python

name: PathCV

name: gis4wrf

detailed_description: A Python codebase designed to facilitate the setup of classical molecular dynamics simulations and the subsequent analysis of results.

name: MDANSE

detailed_description: A software package for analyzing Molecular Dynamics simulations specifically to compute observables relevant to neutron scattering experiments.

name: poreFoam-singlePhase

name: CRISP

name: MAYA

name: metadynminer.py

detailed_description: A Python package for efficient reading, analysis, and visualization of HILLS files generated by Plumed metadynamics simulations.

name: WaterNetworkAnalysis

detailed_description: A set of tools for preparing inputs and analyzing conserved water networks from molecular dynamics trajectories (GROMACS, AMBER).

name: VDOS

name: MolDynPlot

detailed_description: A tool for generating plots from molecular dynamics simulation data, configured via YAML and powered by matplotlib.

name: asent

detailed_description: A Python library for performing efficient and transparent sentiment analysis, often used in social science research and text analysis.

name: Kitware Glance

detailed_description: An open-source web application for visualizing volumetric images, molecular structures, and geometric objects, part of the ParaView/VTK ecosystem.
