detailed_description: A collection of Python utilities and libraries developed and used by the Personal Robotics Laboratory (CMU) for robot control, planning, and integration, supporting various hardware interfaces and robotics frameworks.

name: AROS
one_line_profile: Open Automated Robotic System for Biological Laboratories
detailed_description: An open-source automated robotic system designed specifically for biological laboratories to orchestrate and control various lab instruments and workflows, developed by the Pharmaceutical Bioinformatics group at Uppsala University.

name: pyinstruments
one_line_profile: Python library for controlling laboratory instruments
detailed_description: A Python library providing drivers and interfaces for controlling various laboratory instruments, facilitating data acquisition and experiment automation.

name: PyMeasure
one_line_profile: Scientific measurement library for instruments, experiments, and live-plotting
detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for scientific measurements, offering a framework for controlling instruments, running experiments, and performing live data plotting and analysis.

name: python-usbtmc
one_line_profile: USBTMC driver for controlling instruments over USB
detailed_description: A Python driver implementation of the USB Test and Measurement Class (USBTMC) protocol, enabling control of scientific instruments via USB interfaces without proprietary drivers.

name: python-vxi11
one_line_profile: VXI-11 driver for controlling instruments over Ethernet
detailed_description: A Python driver for the VXI-11 protocol, allowing control of Ethernet-connected test and measurement instruments, compliant with the VXI-11 standard.

name: python-microscope
one_line_profile: Python library for control of microscope devices
detailed_description: A Python library for high-performance control of microscope hardware, including cameras, stages, and light sources, supporting hardware triggers and distributed device control.

name: PyVISA
one_line_profile: Python bindings for the VISA library to control measurement devices
detailed_description: A Python package that provides bindings to the Virtual Instrument Software Architecture (VISA) library, enabling standard control of measurement devices via GPIB, RS232, USB, and Ethernet.

name: PyVISA-py
one_line_profile: Pure Python backend for PyVISA
detailed_description: A pure Python backend for PyVISA that implements the VISA standard protocols (like VXI-11, USBTMC, TCPIP) directly in Python, removing the need for proprietary binary VISA libraries.

name: PyVISA-sim
one_line_profile: PyVISA backend for simulating instruments
detailed_description: A PyVISA backend that simulates the behavior of VISA instruments based on YAML configuration files, allowing for testing and development of instrument control software without physical hardware.

name: QuMADA
one_line_profile: Measurement Abstraction and Database Access layer for QCoDeS

name: wavebin

detailed_description: A Python-based tool for parsing, analyzing, and visualizing binary waveform files captured from oscilloscopes (e.g., Keysight, Rigol), enabling detailed inspection of signal data.

name: msox3000
one_line_profile: Python control library for HP/Agilent/Keysight MSO-X/DSO-X 3000A Oscilloscopes
detailed_description: A Python library utilizing PyVisa to provide remote control and data acquisition capabilities for Keysight MSO-X and DSO-X 3000A series oscilloscopes, enabling automated experimental workflows.

name: oscope-scpi

detailed_description: A Python library for controlling various Keysight oscilloscope models via SCPI commands over PyVisa, facilitating automated measurement and waveform data retrieval for scientific experiments.

name: rust-hackrf-hal

detailed_description: A Rust-based Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) for the HackRF software-defined radio platform, enabling low-level control and signal processing for RF analysis and physics experiments.

name: Labelme
one_line_profile: Image annotation tool for creating scientific training datasets

name: SLM_control_GUI

name: self-driving-lab-demo

detailed_description: A comprehensive software platform for real-time interferometric measurement and feedback control of custom mask-projection photopolymerization additive manufacturing systems. It interfaces with hardware (UV lamp, DMD, camera) to perform online acquisition, analysis, and control.

name: DFlat

name: gpudrive

name: BrazilMet

detailed_description: A simulator oriented to the design and tuning of active control systems (TVC, Active Fin Control) for model rockets. It computes subsonic aerodynamic parameters and integrates 3DOF equations of motion.

name: Marco Polo

detailed_description: An AI agent framework designed to automate scientific experimentation, enabling rigorous and autonomous discovery processes in research environments.

name: Kriging-and-GE-Kriging-model-toolbox

detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox implementing Kriging and Gradient-Enhanced Kriging (GEK) surrogate models, useful for approximating expensive simulation functions in engineering and scientific optimization.

name: Multiple Physics Pretraining

It focuses on leveraging diverse physical datasets to train foundation models that can generalize across different physical systems and partial differential equations.

name: UCSF ChimeraX

name: Radon-Transform_Schultz-Gu

detailed_description: SMT (Surrogate Modeling Toolbox) is a Python package that contains a collection of surrogate modeling methods (e.g., Kriging, RBF, KPLS) and sampling techniques. It is designed to approximate computationally expensive functions in scientific simulation and engineering design optimization.

name: Chaotic-GSA

name: GPyOpt

detailed_description: A Python package for generating surrogate models that interface with calibration tools, designed to assist in uncertainty quantification and model emulation for scientific simulations.

detailed_description: A Python package developed by BASF for generating D-optimal experimental designs, facilitating efficient planning of scientific experiments.

name: HEBO

name: pychimera

name: torch-molecule
one_line_profile: Deep learning package for molecular discovery and property prediction
detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library providing an sklearn-style interface for molecular property prediction, inverse design, and representation learning, aimed at accelerating drug discovery and materials design.

name: PyPSeis
one_line_profile: Package for passive seismic forward modelling and event detection
detailed_description: A Python and C++ package designed for passive seismic forward modeling, microseismic event detection, and source location, supporting acquisition design and synthetic seismogram generation.

name: Multifidelity DeepONet
one_line_profile: Multifidelity deep neural operators for PDE solving
detailed_description: An implementation of multifidelity deep neural operators (DeepONet) for efficiently learning partial differential equations (PDEs), specifically applied to fast inverse design problems like nanoscale heat transport.

name: PROFOIL
one_line_profile: Inverse airfoil design tool
detailed_description: A Fortran-based tool for the inverse design of airfoils, allowing for the generation of airfoil geometries based on prescribed aerodynamic properties.

name: BOA
one_line_profile: High-level Bayesian Optimization framework wrapping Ax and BoTorch
detailed_description: Bayesian Optimization for Anything (BOA) is a framework that simplifies the use of advanced Bayesian optimization libraries (Ax, BoTorch) for experimental planning and parameter tuning in scientific workflows.

name: NNI
one_line_profile: AutoML toolkit for automating feature engineering, neural architecture search, and hyperparameter tuning
detailed_description: Neural Network Intelligence (NNI) is an open source AutoML toolkit that helps users design and tune machine learning models, neural network architectures, and hyper-parameters. In AI4S, it is frequently used as the optimization engine for experimental planning and model search.

name: AGFusion
one_line_profile: Python package to annotate and visualize gene fusions
detailed_description: AGFusion is a tool for annotating and visualizing gene fusions from DNA or RNA sequencing data. It provides detailed information about the fusion protein structure and domains.

name: UQPCE
one_line_profile: Uncertainty Quantification using Polynomial Chaos Expansion
detailed_description: UQPCE is a NASA-developed python-based research code for uncertainty quantification in parametric, non-deterministic computational studies using polynomial chaos expansion surrogate modeling.

name: yacrd
one_line_profile: Quality control tool for detecting chimeric reads in sequencing data
detailed_description: Yet Another Chimeric Read Detector (yacrd) is a tool for quality control of long-read sequencing data, specifically designed to identify and filter chimeric reads.

name: ChiDG
one_line_profile: Chimera-based discontinuous Galerkin solver for CFD
detailed_description: ChiDG is a discontinuous Galerkin solver designed for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) that utilizes Chimera (overset) grids to handle complex geometries.

name: Cassiopee
one_line_profile: CFD pre- and post-processing python modules
detailed_description: Cassiopee is a set of Python modules for pre- and post-processing in Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), developed by ONERA. It handles mesh manipulation, solution extraction, and other CFD workflow tasks.

name: AntiFold
one_line_profile: Inverse folding tool for antibody structure-based design
detailed_description: A tool for improved antibody structure-based design using inverse folding techniques, enabling the generation of antibody sequences that fold into specific structures.

name: DeepCE
one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for phenotype screening
detailed_description: A deep learning framework designed for high-throughput mechanism-driven phenotype screening, facilitating drug response prediction and discovery.

name: BayesOpt
one_line_profile: Toolbox for Bayesian optimization and experimental design
detailed_description: A C++ toolbox for Bayesian optimization, experimental design, and stochastic bandits, widely used for optimizing black-box functions in scientific experiments.

name: DoEgen
one_line_profile: Library for optimised Design of Experiment (DoE) generation
detailed_description: A Python library designed for the generation and evaluation of optimised Designs of Experiments (DoE), facilitating efficient experimental planning.

name: MPOPIS
one_line_profile: Adaptive importance sampling modification to Model Predictive Path Integral (MPPI) control
detailed_description: A Julia implementation of MPOPIS, an adaptive importance sampling method for Model Predictive Path Integral control, useful for optimization and sampling tasks in control systems.

name: ADASYN
one_line_profile: Implementation of Adaptive Synthetic Sampling Approach for imbalanced learning
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the ADASYN algorithm for generating synthetic data samples to address class imbalance problems in machine learning datasets.

name: chimeraviz
one_line_profile: R package for automating the creation of chimeric RNA visualizations
detailed_description: An R package designed to automate the visualization of chimeric RNA, supporting the analysis of fusion events in transcriptomics data.

name: gwsurrogate
one_line_profile: Interface for evaluating gravitational wave surrogate models
detailed_description: A Python package that provides an easy-to-use interface to gravitational wave surrogate models, enabling efficient evaluation of waveforms for astrophysics research.

name: Tea-lang
one_line_profile: Domain-specific language for experimental design and statistical analysis
detailed_description: A domain-specific language (DSL) designed to simplify experimental design and statistical analysis, automating the selection of appropriate statistical tests.

name: dials
one_line_profile: Tools for managing and creating tuning parameter values in the tidymodels ecosystem
detailed_description: Part of the tidymodels ecosystem, dials provides infrastructure to create and manage tuning parameters for statistical modeling and machine learning.

name: tune
one_line_profile: Infrastructure for hyperparameter tuning in the tidymodels ecosystem
detailed_description: Part of the tidymodels ecosystem, tune provides functions and classes for hyperparameter tuning of statistical models.

name: Advisor
one_line_profile: Open-source implementation of Google Vizier for black-box hyperparameter tuning and optimization
detailed_description: A hyperparameter tuning system that implements the Google Vizier interface, supporting black-box optimization for machine learning and scientific experiments.

name: GaUDI
one_line_profile: Guided Diffusion Model for Molecular Inverse Design
detailed_description: GaUDI is a guided diffusion model designed for the inverse design of molecules. It allows for the generation of molecular structures with targeted properties, serving as a generative tool in materials science and chemistry discovery pipelines.

name: vsearch
one_line_profile: Versatile open-source tool for microbiome analysis
detailed_description: VSEARCH is an open-source tool for processing metagenomic sequences, offering functionalities for searching, clustering, chimera detection, and dereplication. It is designed as a free alternative to USEARCH for microbiome data analysis.

name: H_Kriging
one_line_profile: Hierarchical Kriging model implementation for surrogate modeling
detailed_description: H_Kriging is a MATLAB implementation of the Hierarchical Kriging model, a variable fidelity surrogate modeling technique. It is designed to improve upon co-Kriging for experimental planning and simulation in engineering and materials science.

name: EasySurrogate
one_line_profile: Toolkit for creating surrogate models of multiscale systems
detailed_description: EasySurrogate is part of the VECMA toolkit, designed to facilitate the creation of surrogate models for multiscale simulations. It provides workflows and tools to replace expensive computational models with efficient surrogates.

name: AutoOED
one_line_profile: Automated Optimal Experimental Design Platform for materials science
detailed_description: A comprehensive platform for automated optimal experimental design (OED) aimed at accelerating material discovery. It integrates Bayesian optimization and various acquisition functions to guide experimental planning and parameter optimization.

detailed_description: A C++ library providing basic image processing capabilities specifically tailored for Electron Microscopy data, serving as a foundation for other tools in the 3dem ecosystem.

name: RELION

detailed_description: A premier software package for the refinement of macromolecular structures from cryo-electron microscopy (cryo-EM) data, widely used for single-particle analysis.

name: AFMReader

detailed_description: A Python library designed to read and parse data from various proprietary and standard Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM) file formats, facilitating data interoperability.

name: TopoStats

detailed_description: A Python toolkit for automated processing and statistical analysis of Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM) images, particularly useful for tracing topographic features.

detailed_description: A library developed by the AI-READI consortium to assist researchers in making their datasets Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR), specifically for biomedical data.

detailed_description: The second version of the Microscopy Image Browser, offering advanced tools for segmentation and visualization of electron and light microscopy datasets.

name: cuCIM

name: Interactive-Semi-Automatic-Image-2D-Bounding-Box-Annotation-Tool

detailed_description: An interactive tool for rapidly creating 2D bounding box annotations for object detection datasets, utilizing multi-template matching to suggest annotations.

detailed_description: A comprehensive library for image processing in Python, widely used in scientific research for analyzing microscopy, astronomy, and material science imagery. name: VisTrails
one_line_profile: Scientific workflow and provenance management system
detailed_description: An open-source scientific workflow management system that provides comprehensive provenance infrastructure, maintaining detailed history of steps followed and data derived during exploratory computational tasks.

name: SoptSC
one_line_profile: Single-cell data analysis tool for clustering and lineage inference
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for analyzing single-cell RNA-seq data, offering unsupervised inference of clustering, cell lineage, pseudotime, and cell-cell communication networks.

name: LineagePulse
one_line_profile: Differential expression analysis for single-cell RNA-seq
detailed_description: An R package for performing differential expression analysis on single-cell RNA-seq data, specifically designed to handle the noise and dropout characteristics of such data.

name: ACTS
one_line_profile: Particle track reconstruction toolkit for high energy physics
detailed_description: A framework-independent toolkit for charged particle track reconstruction in high energy physics experiments, providing modern C++ implementations of tracking algorithms.

name: Plumpy
one_line_profile: A workflow library for managing processes and provenance in computational science
detailed_description: Plumpy is a Python workflow library that serves as the underlying engine for AiiDA. It enables the creation of state-persistent processes with defined inputs and outputs, facilitating the automation of complex scientific workflows and the tracking of data provenance.

name: Aim
one_line_profile: An open-source experiment tracking tool for machine learning
detailed_description: Aim is a supercharged experiment tracker that logs AI/ML training runs, enabling comparison of hyperparameters, metrics, and images. It provides a UI for visualizing experiment results and ensuring reproducibility in scientific machine learning workflows.

name: Mandala
one_line_profile: A Python framework for experiment tracking and incremental computing
detailed_description: Mandala is an experiment tracking framework that integrates persistence logic directly into Python code. It allows researchers to automatically save and query results of function calls, facilitating complex data analysis pipelines and ensuring reproducibility without boilerplate code.

name: SpecLab
one_line_profile: Testing and compliance framework for medical devices
detailed_description: SpecLab is a C++23 testing framework designed for medical devices. It supports BDD testing and built-in compliance for standards like IEC 62304 and ISO 13485, providing structured test execution and audit trails necessary for regulated scientific/medical environments.

name: Apache Hamilton
one_line_profile: A micro-framework for defining dataflows with lineage and metadata
detailed_description: Apache Hamilton helps data scientists define testable, modular dataflows that automatically encode lineage and metadata. It is used to manage complex data transformation pipelines in scientific computing and machine learning, ensuring traceability and reproducibility.

name: AD-ML
one_line_profile: Framework for reproducible Alzheimer's disease classification
detailed_description: AD-ML is a framework designed for the reproducible classification of Alzheimer's disease using machine learning on neuroimaging data. It provides standardized pipelines to ensure consistent results in medical image analysis.

name: ClinicaDL
one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for reproducible neuroimaging processing
detailed_description: ClinicaDL is a framework for the reproducible processing of neuroimaging data using deep learning methods. It automates the pipeline from raw data to training and evaluation, focusing on reproducibility in clinical neuroscience research.

name: Ogama
one_line_profile: Software for recording and analyzing eye- and mouse-tracking experiments
detailed_description: Ogama (Open Gaze And Mouse Analyzer) is an application for recording and analyzing eye- and mouse-tracking data from slideshow-based experiments. It is used in psychology and neuroscience research to study attention and visual processing.

name: ML Lineage Helper
one_line_profile: Helper library for AWS SageMaker ML Lineage Tracking
detailed_description: A wrapper around SageMaker ML Lineage Tracking that extends lineage capabilities to end-to-end ML lifecycles. It helps researchers and data scientists track artifacts, feature store groups, and queries, ensuring provenance in machine learning workflows.

name: SageMaker Experiments
one_line_profile: SDK for tracking machine learning experiments on SageMaker
detailed_description: A library for tracking experiments and logging metrics for Amazon SageMaker model training. It allows scientists to organize, track, and compare machine learning experiments, facilitating reproducibility and analysis of model performance.

name: K4A.Net
one_line_profile: .NET library for Azure Kinect sensor data acquisition
detailed_description: A library to work with Azure Kinect devices, providing APIs for sensor data recording, playback, and body tracking. It is used in research labs for acquiring depth and motion data for computer vision and biomechanics experiments.

name: Calkit
one_line_profile: Tool for reproducible research project management
detailed_description: Calkit simplifies version control, environment management, and pipeline execution for research projects. It aims to make research reproducible by providing a single-button interface for running and tracking project workflows.

name: Imbalanced Streams
one_line_profile: Framework for experimental analysis of imbalanced data streams
detailed_description: A Java framework for conducting reproducible experiments on learning from imbalanced data streams. It provides implementations of various algorithms and evaluation metrics to facilitate research in data stream mining.

name: Clowder
one_line_profile: Research data management and analysis platform
detailed_description: Clowder is a data management system designed to support research by allowing users to share, annotate, organize, and analyze large collections of datasets. It features an extensible metadata system and an event bus for automatic data curation and analysis.

name: Clowder v2
one_line_profile: Next-generation research data management platform
detailed_description: The second version of the Clowder research data management system, currently in development, aiming to provide enhanced capabilities for managing and analyzing scientific datasets.

name: pyClowder
one_line_profile: Python library for Clowder extractors
detailed_description: A Python library to assist in the development of extractors for the Clowder data management system. It facilitates the creation of automated analysis scripts that process data uploaded to Clowder.

name: Juneberry
one_line_profile: Framework for automating ML training and evaluation
detailed_description: Juneberry improves machine learning experimentation by providing a framework for automating the training, evaluation, and comparison of multiple models against multiple datasets. It focuses on reducing errors and improving reproducibility in ML research.

name: RO-Crate Validator
one_line_profile: Python package to validate Research Object Crates (RO-Crate) metadata
detailed_description: A tool to verify that Research Object Crates (RO-Crates) comply with the official specifications, ensuring data reproducibility and compliance in scientific workflows.

name: DataTracer
one_line_profile: Library for tracking data lineage and provenance in datasets
detailed_description: A library developed by the Data to AI Lab to trace the lineage of data, helping to understand the origin and transformation history of datasets in scientific and data science contexts.

name: Determined
one_line_profile: Deep learning training platform with built-in experiment tracking
detailed_description: An open-source platform for deep learning training that provides integrated experiment tracking, hyperparameter tuning, and resource management, facilitating reproducible AI research.

name: RaceID3_StemID2_package
one_line_profile: Algorithm for cell type and lineage inference from scRNA-seq data
detailed_description: An R package implementing RaceID3 and StemID2 algorithms for the identification of cell types and the inference of lineage trees from single-cell RNA sequencing data.

name: StemID
one_line_profile: Algorithm for lineage tree inference from single-cell data
detailed_description: An algorithm designed to infer lineage trees and cell types from single-cell RNA-seq data, aiding in the understanding of cellular differentiation trajectories.

name: PromptSite
one_line_profile: Version control and tracking system for LLM prompts
detailed_description: A lightweight package for versioning, tracking, experimenting, and debugging Large Language Model (LLM) prompts, supporting reproducible AI engineering and research.

name: paleotree
one_line_profile: R library for analyzing and simulating fossil phylogenies
detailed_description: An R package for analyzing, time-scaling, and simulating phylogenies of extinct/fossil lineages, as well as plotting diversity curves for stratigraphic range data.

name: MLTraq
one_line_profile: Experiment tracking tool for machine learning projects
detailed_description: A library to track and collaborate on Machine Learning & AI experiments, ensuring reproducibility and history management of model training runs.

name: repurpose
one_line_profile: Framework for reproducible drug repurposing prediction
detailed_description: A Python-based framework for building drug-disease association classifiers to support reproducible research in drug repurposing.

name: PyGaze
one_line_profile: Toolbox for programming eye tracking experiments
detailed_description: An open-source toolbox for creating eye-tracking experiments in Python, supporting various eye trackers and providing a high-level interface for experimental control.

name: IEEE-118 Power Flow Data Pipeline
one_line_profile: Pipeline to generate IEEE-118 power system flow cases
detailed_description: A data pipeline tool designed to build and simulate power flow cases for the IEEE-118 bus power system, useful for generating training data for power system studies.

name: transfer-nlp
one_line_profile: Library for reproducible NLP experimentation
detailed_description: A library designed to manage Natural Language Processing (NLP) experiments, promoting reproducibility and ease of transfer learning in AI research.

name: Flyte DataCatalog
one_line_profile: Service for indexing and versioning data artifacts in Flyte
detailed_description: A service component of the Flyte platform that indexes parameterized, strongly-typed data artifacts, enabling memoization and data provenance tracking in scientific workflows.

name: ForML
one_line_profile: MLOps framework for data science project lifecycle management
detailed_description: A development framework and MLOps platform designed to manage the lifecycle of data science projects, from development to deployment, ensuring consistency and reproducibility.

name: trackio
one_line_profile: Lightweight local-first experiment tracking library
detailed_description: A lightweight, local-first experiment tracking library from Hugging Face, designed to simplify the tracking of machine learning experiments without complex infrastructure.

name: Ground
one_line_profile: Vendor-neutral data context service for lineage and versioning
detailed_description: An open-source data context service that manages data lineage, versioning, and metadata, aiming to provide a common substrate for data science and scientific reproducibility.

name: Guild AI
one_line_profile: Experiment tracking and automation tool for machine learning
detailed_description: A tool for tracking machine learning experiments, automating workflows, and comparing results without requiring database setup. It captures source code, configuration, and results to ensure reproducibility.

name: ro-crate-rs
one_line_profile: Rust library for handling Research Object Crates (RO-Crate)
detailed_description: A Rust implementation for creating and manipulating RO-Crates, a community standard for packaging research data with structured metadata to ensure reproducibility and provenance tracking.

name: Intel Experiments API
one_line_profile: Experiment tracking API for machine learning on Kubernetes
detailed_description: A Python API designed to track machine learning experiments, parameters, and metrics, specifically optimized for execution within Kubernetes environments.

name: jeelizPupillometry
one_line_profile: Real-time web-based pupillometry library
detailed_description: A JavaScript/WebGL library for real-time pupil size measurement (pupillometry) using a webcam, enabling physiological data collection for cognitive science and psychology experiments in the browser.

name: Kedro-Viz
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Kedro data pipelines and experiment tracking
detailed_description: An interactive visualization tool for Kedro pipelines that allows data scientists to inspect data lineage, track experiment metrics, and visualize the structure of machine learning workflows.

name: Clowder Server
one_line_profile: Research data management and curation platform
detailed_description: The server-side implementation of Clowder, a web-based data management system designed to support research communities in curating, analyzing, and preserving long-tail data with metadata extraction capabilities.

name: NovaCrate
one_line_profile: Web-based editor for Research Object Crates (RO-Crate)
detailed_description: An interactive web editor for creating, editing, visualizing, and validating RO-Crates, facilitating the packaging of research data with rich metadata for FAIR compliance.

name: Kurator-Akka
one_line_profile: Provenance-enabled workflow platform for biodiversity data curation
detailed_description: A workflow platform based on the Akka actor model designed for curating biodiversity data, with built-in support for tracking data provenance throughout the curation process.

name: LaminDB
one_line_profile: Data framework for biology with lineage and FAIR principles
detailed_description: A data framework specifically for biology that integrates data management, lineage tracking, and ontology management. It acts as a lakehouse and feature store, ensuring data is traceable and reproducible.

name: ProvToolbox
one_line_profile: Java toolkit for W3C PROV data model
detailed_description: A Java library for creating, manipulating, and converting provenance data compliant with the W3C PROV standard. It supports various serializations and enables provenance generation in scientific applications.

name: SingleCellLineage
one_line_profile: Pipeline for processing GESTALT single-cell lineage data
detailed_description: Scripts and pipelines designed to process GESTALT (genome editing of synthetic target arrays for lineage tracing) data at single-cell resolution, enabling reconstruction of cell lineage trees.

name: RSoptSC
one_line_profile: Cell-cell communication and lineage inference from scRNA-seq
detailed_description: An R package for inferring cell-cell communication networks and reconstructing cell lineage trajectories from single-cell RNA sequencing data.

name: CellTagR
one_line_profile: Analysis toolkit for CellTag lineage reconstruction
detailed_description: An R package supporting the analysis of CellTagging data for clonal tracking, clone calling, and lineage reconstruction in single-cell experiments.

name: nf-prov
one_line_profile: Provenance reporting plugin for Nextflow pipelines
detailed_description: A Nextflow plugin that generates comprehensive provenance reports for pipeline executions, supporting standards like BioCompute Objects and RO-Crate for reproducibility.

name: ARCtrl
one_line_profile: Library for Annotated Research Contexts (ARC) management
detailed_description: A polyglot library for creating, manipulating, and validating Annotated Research Contexts (ARCs), a standard for packaging research data and metadata, particularly in plant sciences.

name: ProkEvo
one_line_profile: Framework for bacterial population genomics analyses
detailed_description: An automated, reproducible, and scalable workflow framework designed for high-throughput bacterial population genomics and evolutionary analysis.

name: ya2ro
one_line_profile: Generator for Research Object Crates from YAML
detailed_description: A Python package that automates the creation of Research Object Crates (RO-Crate) from simple YAML configurations, facilitating the packaging and sharing of research data and metadata.

name: Widget Bandsplot
one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for plotting electronic band structure and density of states
detailed_description: A specialized visualization tool for materials science that renders interactive plots for electronic band structures and density of states (DOS) within Jupyter notebooks. Developed by OSSCAR (Open Software Services for Classrooms and Research).

name: STREAM
one_line_profile: Single-cell Trajectories Reconstruction, Exploration And Mapping
detailed_description: An interactive pipeline capable of disentangling and visualizing complex branching trajectories from both single-cell transcriptomic and epigenomic data.

name: Provena
one_line_profile: Provenance system for modelling and simulation workflows
detailed_description: A system designed to manage and track provenance information specifically for scientific modelling and simulation workflows, ensuring reproducibility and auditability of scientific processes.

name: Python Workflow Definition
one_line_profile: Workflow interoperability standard for materials science engines
detailed_description: A library defining a common workflow format to enable interoperability between major materials science workflow engines like AiiDA, Jobflow, and Pyiron.

name: psychopy_ext
one_line_profile: Framework for reproducible behavioral neuroscience experiments
detailed_description: An extension for PsychoPy that facilitates rapid, reproducible design, analysis, and plotting of experiments in behavioral neuroscience and psychology.

name: Phylociraptor
one_line_profile: Rapid and reproducible phylogenomic tree calculator
detailed_description: A highly customizable framework for reproducible phylogenomic inference, automating the calculation of phylogenomic trees from genomic data.

name: DVCP-TE
one_line_profile: Simulation model of the Tennessee Eastman chemical process
detailed_description: A simulation implementation of the Tennessee Eastman chemical process, primarily designed as a testbed for cyber-physical system security research but serving as a scientific process model.

name: showyourwork
one_line_profile: Workflow for reproducible and open scientific articles
detailed_description: A workflow tool that automates the compilation of scientific papers, ensuring that all results and plots are programmatically reproducible from the source code and data.

name: AiiDA-Siesta Plugin
one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the Siesta DFT code to enable automated materials workflows
detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow manager that interfaces with the Siesta density functional theory code, allowing for reproducible and automated electronic structure calculations and provenance tracking.

name: EyeLoop
one_line_profile: Python-based eye-tracking system for dynamic closed-loop experiments
detailed_description: A flexible eye-tracking framework tailored for behavioral experiments, allowing for dynamic, closed-loop interactions on consumer-grade hardware.

name: Seamless
one_line_profile: Framework for reproducible and interactive computations in scientific workflows
detailed_description: A framework designed to set up reproducible computations and visualizations that respond to changes in data or code cells, ensuring provenance and interactivity in scientific data analysis.

name: HELM
one_line_profile: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models framework
detailed_description: A comprehensive framework for the holistic, reproducible, and transparent evaluation of foundation models (LLMs), critical for assessing AI models used in scientific research.

name: LineageExplorer
one_line_profile: Tool for estimating growth rate advantage of SARS-CoV2 variants
detailed_description: A tool designed to analyze international genomic surveillance data to estimate the growth rate advantage of SARS-CoV2 variants of concern using multinomial spline fits.

name: DVC
one_line_profile: Open-source version control system for machine learning projects
detailed_description: Data Version Control (DVC) is a tool for data science and machine learning projects that enables data versioning, experiment tracking, and reproducibility, integrating with Git.

name: DVCLive
one_line_profile: Library for logging ML metrics and tracking experiments with DVC
detailed_description: A Python library to log machine learning metrics, parameters, and model artifacts, designed to work seamlessly with DVC for experiment tracking and visualization.

name: TruLens
one_line_profile: Evaluation and tracking framework for LLM experiments
detailed_description: A tool for evaluating and tracking Large Language Model (LLM) based applications, providing feedback functions and observability for AI experiments.

name: PROV Python
one_line_profile: Python library for the W3C Provenance Data Model (PROV)
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the W3C PROV data model, allowing for the generation, serialization, and export of provenance information in scientific workflows.

name: CoRR
one_line_profile: Cloud of Reproducible Records platform by NIST
detailed_description: A platform developed by NIST to support the management and sharing of reproducible records for scientific computations and simulations.

name: OpenCorr
one_line_profile: Library for Digital Image and Volume Correlation
detailed_description: An open-source C++ library for Digital Image Correlation (DIC) and Digital Volume Correlation (DVC), used for strain and deformation measurement in materials science.

name: Deepkit ML
one_line_profile: Collaborative machine learning development and experiment tracking suite
detailed_description: A comprehensive development tool and training suite for machine learning that includes experiment execution, tracking, debugging, and project management features.

name: galaxy2cwl
one_line_profile: Converter to export Galaxy workflows to Common Workflow Language (CWL) format
detailed_description: A standalone tool designed to facilitate the interoperability and reproducibility of scientific workflows by converting Galaxy workflow descriptions and execution logs into the standard Common Workflow Language (CWL) format. This supports the auditing and portability of bioinformatics and computational science pipelines.

name: ZnTrack
one_line_profile: Parameter tracking and workflow management for scientific Python pipelines
detailed_description: A lightweight interface built on top of DVC (Data Version Control) specifically tailored for scientific computing. It allows researchers to define, run, and track parameters/metrics of computational pipelines (e.g., molecular dynamics, ML potentials) directly from Python or Jupyter Notebooks, facilitating reproducibility and experiment tracking in materials science and chemistry.
